Joyce works hard to support her family. She has a common-law husband and has a Ready-To-Wear clothing business in the Philippines. Joyce is borrowing PHP 1,800  through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Joyce is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she's helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit Cookstove

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Christine works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and her motorcycle transport business.  Christine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of dried fish for her dried fish business.

Christine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucia is 53 years old. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase thread, zippers, fabric and other tailoring materials.

Lucia has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring materials such as zippers and thread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She recently got married and doesn’t have any children. She spends most of her time weaving carpets and doing her household responsibilities. She learnt the art of weaving carpets from her mother and started this to financially support her husband. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a vegetable vendor. His shop is located in the nearby market and he provides to his customers fresh seasonal vegetables at reasonable prices. Through the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell and earn a good profit. 

Bushra is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application through Asasah. She is confident about the future growth of her husband’s business after making a loan investment in it. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mrs. Mara K. (pictured) is a 40-year-old, married woman. Her husband, Mr. Sawy Son, who she has been married to since 1990, is 43 years old. They have five children: one son and four daughters. Four of their children are in school, while the other child is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a village off National Road Number Two, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

To earn a living, Mara is a construction worker, while her husband is a policeman. She is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to get to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get to school.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 49-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, who are both in school.

To earn a living, Elizabeth is in the poultry business. Specifically, she raises ducks in the Philippines. Elizabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP ($275) through NWTF to buy feed for her ducks. Elizabeth explains that she has been in the duck-raising business for four years now, and that she has borrowed from NWTF on three prior occasions to sustain her business. In the future, Elizabeth would like to expand her duck-raising business to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her animals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta V. is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates an entertainment business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 16 years, and that she earns additional income from a general store.

She is seeking a loan in the amount of 17,000 PHP ($400) through NWTF to purchase additional pieces of equipment for her entertainment business. Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to better provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes, a 49-year-old married mother of two children, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. Having borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF, she is now requesting one for PHP 17,000 to purchase  additional items to sell in her store including shampoo, soap, and canned goods. Lourdes  aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en: Leab T. is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. They live along National Road 2, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Leap is a rice farmer. She also sells Khmer noodles in her village when she is not at the farm. Khmer noodles or Num Banh Chok are considered the national dish of Cambodia; it can be served with a green curry soup, banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks, and cucumber. Leap is requesting a loan of $300 to dig a well for family use.

loans.use: To dig a well for family use

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en: Samoeun M. is 27 years old, married, and has two children. They live in a suburb approximately 25 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh. Samoeun stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary. He has full-time employment in Phnom Penh.  Samoeun hopes to run beauty salon. She is requesting a loan for $1,000 to build a beauty salon.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon.

loans.name: Ma. Concepcion

texts.en: Ma. Concepcion works hard to support three children. She is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Ma. Concepcion requested a 1,500-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to lessen firewood consumption when cooking. Ma. Concepcion is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a cleaner, more efficient cookstove

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheak S. (pictured here) is 34 years old. Her husband, Mr. Saret Sean, is 48 years old. They have no children yet. The couple is living in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sopheak is a garment-factory worker, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old, and he spends a lot of money to make repairs very often. It’s difficult for him to generate income to support his family. Facing this problem, Sopheak is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Yanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Yanna H. (pictured above) is 39. She is hired by her villagers to put together fabric swatches for clothing manufacturers. Her husband, Mr. Ruos Reang, is 41. He is a tuk-tuk driver. Unhappily, his tuk-tuk broke down and did not work well, so he decided to sell it. He hopes to apply for a loan--to use with the money from selling his old tuk-tuk--in order to purchase a new one. That’s why Yanna is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to help with her husband's purchase. 

The couple has been married since 1995. They have three children--two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk-tuk for her husband

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha L. (pictured with her loom) has been married for just three months and has no children yet. She is a silk weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

The family does not have any means of transportation. They spend a lot of money on traveling costs very often, so Sokha is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married and has two adult children. She lives in Melitopol and sells jewelry in one of the local markets. She offers a wide variety of merchandise for sale in her vending location. Alla has been in this business for 15 years. She has 50,000 UAH worth of inventory. Her monthly net income is about 6,000 UAH. 

Alla lives with her husband and eldest daughter, a single mother raising a 3 year old daughter. Four years ago, Alla helped her daughter to start her own business selling similar products. Both businesses are developing well, bringing a stable income to this hard working family.

Alla is seeking a loan of 18,000 UAH to purchase assorted items to add to the inventory that she already offers for retail sale. She is hoping to continue developing her trade in the future and to see it flourish even more.

loans.use: to purchase assorted items for inventory.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha S. is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokoeurn Oeorn is 29 years old. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been there since 2005 and just have one young son.

Sokha and his wife sell mangoes and jicama. They buy them under contract from their fellow villagers and transport them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sokha is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional mangoes for resale.

Photo: Mr. Sokha S. and his wife

loans.use: to purchase additional mangoes under contract for resale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a happy mother who has raised two children. They are now grown and live separately. Valentina is a successful entrepreneur from the Kahovka, Kherson region in the south-east of Ukraine. She sells footwear in one of the local markets and she has been in this trade for 15 years. An economic crisis and high unemployment rates forced her to launch a small venture and to take the financial risks that come along with it. 

Valentina managed not only to survive in highly unfavorable surroundings but also to make her business sustainable. Currently, she has about 60,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about 8,000 Grivnyas. 

Valentina says she is happy to be able to provide for her family and realizes they have everything they need for normal life. Moreover, she enjoys working with people on a daily basis, learning to serve her customers better and getting more experience along the way. Valentina is requesting a 20,000 Gryvna loan to purchase 250 pairs of women shoes and re-stock her inventory for the spring/summer season.

loans.use: to purchase 250 pairs of women's shoes

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children, age eight and 11, both attend local secondary school. 

He manages a coal and wood trading business at a local market called Hangai. He started his business in 2001 and gained much experience. Through years of business operation he managed to stabilize his business and is planning to continue it. He is an honest man who says, "I am happy to have consistent earnings by operating my business." He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) loan to buy more coal and firewood for his business sales.

loans.use: to buy more coal and firewood

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow. She has two children: her son is 20 and her younger daughter is only 7. She lives in Stryi. Nataliya owns a small clothing merchandise business. She sells tees, shoe polishers, razors, toothbrushes and other retail items in her little store. 

She has been in the trade for 8 years. Her income is slightly over 7,000 Grivnyas. Nataliya is a hard worker. She is willing to invest much effort in her venture to see it grow and develop more in the future. Nataliya is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to restock her store and to boost her sales as a result. Nataliya’s goal is to provide for her two daughters and help the older one to pay for college.

loans.use: to restock her inventory

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Mrs. Ann K. (pictured here), 59, is a widow with one daughter who is a garment factory worker. She also has one niece and one nephew living with her. They live in a village on National Road number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Ann is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger, 32, is married and lives with his wife and two children in a rented basement of an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His older son, aged 8, goes to a secondary school. His younger child hasn't reached school age. 

Batdelger manages a wool products making and trading business, with the help of his wife. She used to work at one of the wool manufacturer's for several years. Batdelger used to operate a clothes trading business at a local market. 

Three years ago, based on his trading skills and on his wife's clothes making skills, they began to operate a wool products manufacturing business. They rent a small basement where they live and work. Through successful business operations they have managed to buy three sewing machines. They are very hardworking people, trying hard to improve their life. They say that they want to have their own house in the future. He is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for his manufacturing business, such as another sewing machine.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. (pictured here) sells jackfruits. Her husband, Mr. Boran Kheav, is a motor taxi driver. She has asked for a Kiva loan two times already. She now hopes to continue expanding her business. So, she is requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase more jackfruits for resale. 
The couple lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. They have four children: two sons and two daughters.

loans.use: To purchase more jackfruits for resale.

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
Mrs. Rit P. is 38 years loan and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Chea, is 41 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have three sons. One of their children is a construction worker and the other two are in school.  

Rit sells vegetables in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a lathe operator. Rit is asking for her first loan of $600 to fill-up the land around her house and to renovate the house where she lives.  

Photo: Mrs. Rit P. and her husband.

loans.use: To fill-up the land around her house and to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chheng S. (pictured above) sells pigs. He buys pigs from his village and sells them to the slaughter house. His wife, Mrs. Sokheang S., sells beef in Phnom Penh market. 

Chheng hopes to supplement his new business raising pig. He will be able to get extra income from selling pigs when they grow big enough. So, he is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase piglets to raise.

This couple lives across the Mekong River, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao S. (pictured with her young daughter) and her husband, Mr. Sie Sun, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They just have a young daughter.  

Sreymao sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman. In addition, the couple also grows rice lotus. They hope to expand their farming business by growing watermelons, so Sreymao is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for growing water melon.

loans.name: Meu

texts.en:
Mrs. Meu S. (pictured above) and husband, Mr. Khan Seur, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have eight children: two sons and six daughters. One is married, three are garment factory workers, one sells soft drinks, two are in school and another one assists the parents in the business.   

Meu and her husband are vegetable farmers. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help with her daughter’s business by purchasing additional soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: To help with her daughter’s business by purchasing additional soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea M. (pictured here), 41, is a widow with one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a construction worker and another one is in school. They are living along National Road two, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Sophea M. is a farmer and she also buys additional vegetables from the fellow villagers for resale. She is asking for a loan of loan of $1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her son, a construction worker, to drive to work. She will also use a part of the loan to fill-up the land around her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son who is a construction worker to drive to work and also to fill-up the land around her house.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a resident of Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family in a single room brick house for the past 16 years. She is 44 years old and married to R. A., who repairs cooking ranges. He is very good at his work and provides first class repair services to his clients at a very reasonable cost.

Azra has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her sons are young and at school while her daughters have a hosiery business. Azra also works. In order to support her husband financially, she weaves carpets. The income she earns helps her pay the school fees for her children. She is also a very good housewife and fulfills her household work very well.

Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy tools to provide better quality repair services to his clients and earn more profits. Azra hopes that her husband (who has been operating his business for more than 10 years) will get more success in his business after investing this loan into it. 

Azra is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous years, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: to buy tools for a cooking range repair business.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat G. is 38 years old. He is married and he has a daughter who is a student. Azat's family lives in Tsovagyugh village, an area of Sevan.
Since 1997 Azat has engaged in land cultivation and animal husbandry. He raises cows, sheep, horses, a pig and chickens. On his land he grows garlic and potatoes. Azat's wife helps him in farming and thus they solve their family's needs and pay for their daughter's education. 

Azat has received loans from Nor Horizon two times and now he is asking for a 400,000 AMD (Armenian Dram) to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan is a widowed woman. She lives with her three children in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in her older brother's backyard. Her older two children, aged 13 and 17, go to a local secondary school. The younger one hasn't reached school age yet. 

Bayarsaihan manages a grocery trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2008 at a rented booth and gained much experience. She is planning to expand her business and wants to have her own supermarket in the future. She is an honest women who says, "I am trying hard to feed my family." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children, aged 1 and 3, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in his parent's backyard. He manages a fruit and sweet-stuff trading business with the help of his wife. 

Batbayar started his business in 2008 at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the crowded and busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. Since then, his business has become quite profitable which has allowed him to buy a car. Now, his monthly sales have reached to 200,000 MNT, with daily earning of 70,000 MNT. In addition to his fruit-trading business, he began to operate a taxi service in order to add to his family's earnings. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a hardworking man who says, "I am saving my earnings in order to renew my car in the near future." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Tsolmonbaatar

texts.en:
Tsolmonbaatar is a 28-year-old man living with his wife and two daughters in a ger, which is a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His older daughter attends kindergarten, while his younger one, who is 5 months old, stays home with her mother.

To earn a living, he manages a photo studio business in his town. Based on teaching and instruction from his brother, he started his business in 2008. At first, it was quite hard to manage his photo studio. But, through hard work, he managed to stabilize his business and to build a strong customer base. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a diligent man who says, "I am doing my best in order to feed my family."

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 MNT ($2,400) to buy new photo equipment for his studio.

loans.use: To purchase new photo equipment for his studio

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry T. is a 49-year-old married woman. Her husband, Mr. Pha Phal, is 45 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1985, and they have six children (one son and five daughters). Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, one child is a garment factory worker, and the other three children are in school.

To earn a living, Mrs. Ry T. and her husband (pictured at their home) work in the agriculture sector. Specifically, they grow lotus on their farm land in the village where they live. Ry is asking for her first loan, in the amount of $400, to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her lotus farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is an active lady, carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife and mother very well. She prefers to stay at home and take care of her family. She is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family in a three-room brick house for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is M. S. and he is a scrap dealer. He supplies scrap to different factories and to other scrap dealers on demand and generates income for the family.  

Razia has four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son left his education and started working. He is a bus conductor. The other two are enrolled in a local school getting their education. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to buy scrap to fulfill the demands of his clients. With the loan, he will buy scrap such as used paper, plastic bottles, etc. He has been operating this business for the past many years and is well known among his clients for his good work. Razia hopes that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business and will help her family to live a better financial life as a result. 

Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous years, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: to buy scrap for a scrap business.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophors D. and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Um, who is 32 years old, live in a village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have one young daughter.

To earn a living and to support their family, Sophors and her husband are garment factory workers. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair her family's kitchen and to fill the land around her house.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen and to fill the land around her house

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S. (pictured) is a married woman, living with her family in a village along National Road number 2, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She and her husband have two sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school.

To earn a living, she used to sell grocery items at her home. Now, she is a garment factory worker. Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction contractor.

Sophal is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike so that her husband can drive to work

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra S. (pictured) is a married, 38-year-old woman. Her husband, Mr. Ra Em, who she has been married to since 2005, is 44 years old. They do not have any children. They live in a village along National Road number 2, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Ra S. is a garment factory worker, while her husband raises chicken and ducks at their home. She is asking for her first loan, which would be in the amount of $500, to repair the roof of the house where her family lives.

loans.use: To repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun C. (pictured here) is a weaver. Her husband is a fisherman and farmer. She is requesting another loan of US $600 to help with her husband’s farming by purchase a water pumping machine and to pay for plowing fees.

The couple has five sons and two daughters. Two are married, one lives in separated home and another one stays in the family home. Two are construction workers, one weaves silk at home, one is a garment factory worker and the other one is in school. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s farming by purchase a water pumping machine and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Koemleng

texts.en:
Mr. Koemleng K. and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Tean, have seven children. Two are garment factory workers, one is a hair dresser, two stay at home and the other two attend school. The family lives in a village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh City. 

Koemleng is a truck driver, while his wife is a farmer. He previously asked for a Kiva loan to build a beauty salon and to buy some materials for his daughters. However, his village needed to arrange a more functional water system, so he changed the purpose of his loan to bury a highway drainage pipe.
 
He is now asking for his second loan of $1,000 to continue his project of building a beauty salon and to buy some materials for his daughters.

Mr. Koemleng K. and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon and to buy some materials for his daughters.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhay K. (pictured here) and her husband are farmers. They have three sons and three daughters and live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chhay is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri is 44 years old and lives with his wife and only son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son, 10, goes to a local secondary school. 

Batsuuri manages a used clothes trading business with the help of his wife. They started their business in 2000 by selling used shoes at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the biggest markets. Their business has stabilized and this has allowed him to open one more booth near to his home. Now his wife is responsible for selling used clothes while Batsuuri is responsible for selling used shoes. He is planning to continue his business in the future. He is a polite man who says, "We live in a very small house. So I am planning to make my house bigger." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to repair his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction material.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en: Ma. Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, cooking oil, etc., for her restaurant business. Ma. Delia has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from sugarcane and rice farming. Ma. Delia has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Chuluunhuu

texts.en: Chuluunhuu is 44 years old and lives in a ger (Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent) in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. She manages a shoe trading business in Narantuul market, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2000. Since then her business has been quite successful which has allowed her to buy a plot of land where she lives now. She attributes her business success to the good location of her rented stall. Now her daily earnings exceed 50,000-70,000 tugriks (MNT). She is planning to increase her collection of shoes in order to increase her business sales. She is a very hardworking woman who pays great attention to performing or completing a task satisfactorily. She says that she wants to build a house on her plot of land. She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of shoes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 47 years old. She is married and has 8 children.

She earns her living with her hog raising business in the Philippines. Maritess is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

Maritess has been in the hog-raising business for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her hog raising business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 32 years old and is married. She has six children, aged between 12 months and 10 years old. Regine sells second hand such as: women`s clothes, men`s clothes and childrens' clothes. Her business is well-organized. She has 6 years experience in her business and she starts her work from 7am until 6pm every day. Regine is currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender via vision finance company in order to expand her clothes business by purchasing different clothes to sell like: women`s clothes, men`s clothes and childrens' clothes for improving her business. With this profit, Regine will reinvest in her business, to pay school fees for her children and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand such as: women's clothes, men's clothes and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 39 years old and she lives with her two daughters in a house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. Her older daughter, 18, goes to a secondary school while younger one is in kindergarten. 

Tuvshinjargal manages a household good trading business at a rented stall at Harhorin market, second biggest market in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2002. She sells variety of blankets, sheets, quilts and sleeping bag etc. She has gained much experience and is planning to continue her business in the future. She is an honest women who says, "I am doing my best to feed my children and to pay their education cost." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods for her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more goods.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. Josephine earns a living by selling various goods such as: soft drinks, lotion, toilet papers etc. This is her tenth successful year in this business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except on the weekends and she employs one person to help her.

Josephine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more varied goods to sell such as: soft drinks, lotion, toilet papers etc. By expanding her business and adding more goods and workers, Josephine hopes to earn more profits. She will save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more various goods to sell such as: soft drinks, lotion, toilet papers, etc.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son in a house in Sansar area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She manages a shoemaking business with the help of her husband. 

Munhtsetseg started her business in 2009. In Mongolia shoe making is still a traditionally handi-crafted profession. She produces a range of footwear items, including shoes, boots, sandals, clogs and moccasins. She is planning to expand her business and to employ more workers in the future. Munhtsetseg is vivacious person who says, "I am planning to expand my business and want to have my own factory in the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to build a factory building for her business.

loans.use: To build a factory building.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Ouynchimeg is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her elder daughter is a student. 

Ouynchimeg manages a grocery trading store with the help of her husband. She started her business in 1997. Previously, she operated a small grocery booth. Through years of business operation she managed to stabilize her business and build a grocery store near to her home. She is planning to expand and continue her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I am planning to make my store building much bigger in the future." She is requesting a 3,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 29 years old and single. She sells spare parts in her business. Her business is well-organized. She has 1 year's experience in her business and she starts her work from 6am until 10pm every day. Chantal is currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender via vision finance company in order to purchase more spare parts to sell. With the extra profits, Chantal will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 28 years old and is married with three children aged between 2 and 5 years old. Leocadie sells various items in her arts business such as: crafts, drawing etc. Her business is well-organized. She has 8 year's experience in her business and she starts her work from 6am until 9pm every day. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender via vision finance company in order to expand her arts business by purchasing more items to sell like: crafts, drawing etc for improving her business. With this profit, Leocadie will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To expand her arts business.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma resides in Ghala mandi, an area of a city called Sahiwal. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years. She is a housewife who manages her household work by staying at home. 
She is married to M. A. who is a fruit vendor by profession. He puts the fruit on his cart and starts selling early in the morning by visiting different streets of the city. He deals with his clients very well and makes good sales every day due to the good quality of his fruits. Najma is a very supportive person. She helps her husband by arranging the fruit for him on his cart. She has given birth to four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell and earn better profits. He has been operating this business for the past 12 years and hopes that a loan will bring positive financial changes to his business. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Najma.

loans.use: To buy fresh seaonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is married and has 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodelia is 40 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Rodelia has a lumberyard business in the Philippines. Rodelia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional lumber for her lumberyard business.

Rodelia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Rodelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional lumber for her lumberyard business.

loans.name: Marie Claudine

texts.en:
Marie Claudine is 37 years old and is married. She has three children between the ages of 4 and 16 years old. She sells different items such as: crafts, drawing etc. Her business is well-organized. She employees one person to help her. Marie Claudine has seven years experience and she runs her business from 6.30am until 9pm every day.

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more different items for her arts business like: crafts, drawing etc. With the extra profits, Marie Claudine will expand her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: To expand her arts business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 26 years old and is married with two children. She has a small shop where sells various goods such as lotions, soap, and rice.  She has had her business for seven years and is well organized.  Her shop is open from 9 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Christine has requested this loan from in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store such as lotions, soap, rice, soft drinks, and biscuits.  Christine plans to reinvest any extra profit she makes as a result of this loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase good such as lotions, soap, and rice as inventory for a small general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drugs for a medical clinic

loans.name: Arodie

texts.en:
Arodie is 32 years old and is single. She has a small shop where she sells items such as soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and lotion. She has had her business for over a year, and feels it is well organized. Arodie works from 7:30 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. every day except on Sunday. 

Arodie has requested this loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, bread, biscuits, lotion, and other items for her shop. With any extra profit she makes, she hops to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, biscuits, lotion, and other items to sell at a small general store

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emilia works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business, and earns additional income from buying and selling crabs.  Emilia plans to use the proceeds of this 19,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan to purchase nets and other fishing equipment.

Emilia has taken out five loans from Kiva field partner NWTF before this one, which have helped sustain her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of being able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy of nets and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Roselen

texts.en:
Roselen is 38 years old and married with two children.  She runs a sari-sari store (a small general store) and works hard to provide for her family.  She has requested a loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan from Kiva field partner NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her shop.

Before this loan, Roselen borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for two years and also earns income from frozen foods, being a cosmetics dealer, and raising livestock.  She aspires to save money to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as  shampoo and groceries to sell at a small general store

loans.name: C4822 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Sifa, a 28-year-old married mother of three children ranging in age from 5 to 12 years old, is the president of a group called “Abishyizehamwe.” Sifa has been selling bananas for five years, working from 6 am until 9:30 pm everyday.

Sifa has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more bananas, beans, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, etc. in order to increase her profits. She will save a portion of those profits and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell such as bananas, beans, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his young family and his desire is to build a house and educate his children. He has been in the retail business for two years. The business is profitable as he has been able to meet the daily needs of his family. His hardships are seasonal business and theft and his vision is a wholesale shop plus building a house. Amon needs the loan to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Zephania

texts.en: Zephania is a 36-year-old married man with five children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in secondhand shoes for four years. He started with a capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. His hardship is lack of enough capital and his vision is business expansion plus building a better house. Zephania needs the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen has been living in Sahiwal for the past 12 years with her family in a two-room brick house. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture. She is 39 years old and has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works with his father in his Punjabi food restaurant business. Yasmeen’s husband whose name is J. H. operates his restaurant in the market where he sells different varieties of Punjabi food at cheap rates. The taste is good and that’s why he attracts a good number of customers every day. Her eldest daughter sews clothes for her neighboring clients and the other two children are studying at a local school. 

Yasmeen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very supportive lady who tries her best to provide relief to her family with her work. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase items such as spices, cooking oil, lentils, rice, etc. to prepare larger quantities of food to sell in his restaurant. Yasmeen is confident that an investment in her husband’s business will be a good step towards its growth. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: to buy spices, cooking oil, lentils, rice, etc. to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 31 years old and married with three children between 3 and 6 years old.  Elias sells various goods such as lotions, soft drinks, soap, rice, etc. Elias works from 6am to 6pm every day.  He has been in this business for five years and he currently employs one person to help him.

Elias has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for expanding his business by purchasing more goods such as lotions, soft drinks, soap, rice, toothpaste etc to earn a good profit.  With this loan, Elias will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to save in the future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell such as lotions, soft drinks, soap, rice etc.

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara H. is the leader of this group. She is 22 and married to a builder. Her husband works in Russia. In order to meet the family needs, Gulnara grows cotton. She has a baby so her parents-in-law help her in farming. The family started cultivating cotton three years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. When they sell some part of the harvest, the family earns 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Gulnara wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for farming. In the future, she plans to start repairing her house and purchasing some livestock for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Taalaybek

texts.en:
Taalaybek B. is 48, married and lives with his family in Teplokuchenka village. He works as a teacher at the local school and is known as a responsible and hard-working person. He has three children. The younger one is the main helper in the animal breeding business.  Taalaybek started this business in 1991 with an initial capital of 1,000 KGS, which was used to purchase one cow and sheep. Today he has two cows, a horse and sheep at his farm, which gives him about 5-6,000 KGS in a month.  Now, Taalaybek wants to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more cattle in order to enlarge his farm.  With the revenues, he plans to pay for the education of his son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who is involved in the transportation business. He drives a rickshaw and provides pick-up and drop-off services to his passengers and school children. His rickshaw has grown old and its engine needs repair work. With the loan, he will repair the engine, which will help him provide better transport services and earn better profits. 

Naseem is a widow who lost her husband few years ago. It was a difficult time for her but she worked very hard to raise her two sons. Her youngest son works in a factory and contributes to the family financially from his earnings. Both of her sons were educated to the 5th standard but couldn’t study further due to Naseem's poor financial conditions. Naseem now prefers staying at home and doing her household work. She lives in Sahiwal, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Ghala mandi in a two-room brick house for the last 20 years. 

She hopes that through the loan, her son’s business will improve and she will be able to marry him soon. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She is a very responsible client and in previous loans, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To repair her son's rickshaw

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul T. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and two daughters. The youngest daughter studies at university and the other children are married. In order to meet the family needs, Aigul and her husband breed livestock animals. They resell some animals at a higher price after fattening. In this way, they earn 5,600 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Aigul wants to purchase a TV in order to improve their living conditions. In the future, she dreams of building a house in Bishkek for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a television

loans.name: C4369 Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Denise is 24 years old and is single.  She currently works in a shop in Kimironko district. She takes care of two relatives who are 8 to 20 years old. She runs a well-organized small store which sells bananas. She has been operating it successfully for three years and her shop is open from 7am until 7pm every day.  

Denise is the leader of this group, called "Ubumwe" in the local language, which means "reconciliation". The group consists of two men and five women. Denise is the second person on the left, raising her hand.

The group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company, to purchase more bananas for their market, so they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock for bananas, which will allow them to earn more profits. With this extra income they all earn, Denise and her group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Shaiymkul's Group

texts.en:
Shaiymkul A. is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a taxi driver. She has four daughters and a son. Her two older daughters work in Russia and the other children study at school. The family is engaged in agriculture. They breed livestock animals and cultivate agricultural products. Shaiymkul started to breed livestock two years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. By reselling livestock after fattening, they earn 1,500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Shaiymkul wants to purchase a variety of seeds for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Samar

texts.ar: سمر فتاة عزباء تعيش في بعلبك تعمل في بيع الفوبيجو والاكسسوار لها في عملها 3 سنوات تحب عملها وهي فتاة تعتمد على نفسها في تطوير عملها تريد ان تزيد من مدخولها وان تحسن الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها تساعد اهلها في تخطي الاوضاع المادية الضيقة فهي حنونة محبة للأهل وتعيلهم تريد من خلال طلبها قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتحسين وضع المحل لها زبائن من ابناء البلدة تعاني من ضعف في السيولة ما يعيق تقدمها في العمل وعندها رغبة كبيرة في تغيير هذا الوضع لأنها تحب ما تعمل تتميز بالجودة في البضاعة والاسعار الجيدة
texts.en: Samar is an unmarried and lives in Ba'albek. She works selling faux jewelry and accessories. She has three years of experience in this line of work. She likes her work, and she is self-reliant in developing her business. She would like to increase her income and improve her material situation as well as her social status. She helps her family overcome their financial difficulties as she is caring and loves her family and wants to provide for them. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods for her store in order to improve her store. She has customers from among the residents in her town. She lacks financial liquidity, and this is what is hindering her from progressing in her business. However, she very much wants to get past this barrier because she loves her work. She stands out in her field due to the quality of her goods and her good prices.

loans.use: buy goods for her faux jewelry and accessories shop.

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en:
Zipora is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages 3 and 12 years old. Zipora sells beans and sorghum. Her business is well organized. She employs two people in her business and has three year's of experience.

Zipora has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more beans and sorghum. With the profits, Zipora will pay school fees for her children and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of beans and sorghum

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 31 years old and is married with three children between 3 and 8 years old. Innocent sells a vareity of merchandise in his business such as cooking oil, body lotion, bread, soap, juice and so on. Innocent has had his business for six years. His business is well organized.

Innocent has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more foodstuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil and so on. With his profit, he will be able to build his own house and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To puchase more goods like cooking oil, body lotion, bread, juice, and soap.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.ar: خليل رجل متزوج وله ولد يعمل في بيع المطبوعات والاوراق والايصالات له في عمله منذ 9 سنوات له من العمر 57 سنة يحب عمله يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يحسن من وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وتأمين المنزل الجيد الذي يناسب عائلته حتى يؤمن لهم المسكن الامن يريد من طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للعمل وشراء ماكنة وتكملة ما تبقى من عمار منزله فهو طموح يحب العائلة وهي كل اهتمامه له زبائن من محيطه ولا يعاني سوى من بعض النقص المادي الذي يحول دون تطور العمل وتحسين المدخول الشهري يسعى الى تأمين منزل يؤمن له الاستقلالية في العيش مع زوجته واسرته ويحلم بأن يصبح له مطبعة كبيرة تضم جميع المطبوعات وغيرها وكان للقرض الاسبق مع المجموعة اثر كبير في تحسين العمل وكان يلقى الدعم من الاسرة التي تحضنه
texts.en: Khalil is married with one child, and he works selling printed items, paper and receipts. He has nine years of experience in this field. He is 57 years old and likes his work. He would like to increase his income and improve his material situation in addition to his social status. He would also like to procure a good home which is suitable for his family so that he can guarantee them a secure place to live. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy goods and equipment for his shop, as well as finish building his home. He is ambitious and loves his family, and they are his primary concern in life. He has customers from his community, and he isn't having any difficulties with his business other than a lack of material resources. However, this is preventing him from developing his shop, just as it is preventing him from increasing his monthly income. He is trying to secure a home which will enable to live with more autonomy with his wife and family. His dream is to own a large print shop which offers services for all kinds of printed products and other products. His last loan with al-Majmoua greatly helped him to improve his business, and he received the full support and encouragement of his family during it.

loans.use: buy goods and equipment for his print shop.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 33 and married with two children between the ages 3 and 8 years old.  He has been selling various products such as rice, sugar, juice, bread, bananas, soap etc. He has two years of experience.

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for his store like rice, sugar, cosmetics and so on. With his profits, he expects to save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell like juice, sugar, bread, bananas, soap etc.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe N. lives in Yerevan together with his pensioner parents. He produces and trades in linen, blankets and covers. Vahe’s business is the family’s main source of income. Vahe plans to produce more goods and increase his working capital.  With the requested loan, he plans to purchase necessary fabric and other materials. The business expansion will allow Vahe to increase his income and insure better living conditions for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and other materials

loans.name: Shemussa

texts.en:
Shemussa is 26 years old and is married with one child, who is 7 years old. She owns a small business selling various styles of African clothes for women. This business is well known and organized. She has two years of experience in this business.

Shemussa has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more African clothes to sell. Once this expansion is reached, Shemussa will be able to earn more profit. With this extra profit, she plans to build her own house and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga H. lives in Yerevan with her daughter who is a student. She has been engaged in the clothing trade since 2003. Olga rents a premise in the city and trades in women’s clothing, which is the family’s main source of income. To continue doing business, Olga needs to purchase clothing stock, and this loan is taken for that purpose. Olga’s income covers the family’s needs and her daughter’s university fees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan H. lives in Yerevan together with his parents and brother. He runs a small pet shop where he trades pet food, fish and aquariums.  Stepan’s father is a pensioner and helps him in the business. Trading is the main source of income in the family. Stepan wants to develop the business and increase his income. Currently, he has a high demand for new aquariums and fish. Stepan would like to purchase glass to make the aquariums and purchase fish. With the help of this loan, Stepan will be able to develop his business and insure sustainable income for his household.

loans.use: to purchase fish and glass for aquariums

loans.name: Youssef

texts.ar: يوسف رجل اعزب عمره 22 سنة يعمل في بلاط المنازل له في عمله 7 سنوات يسعى الى تطور العمل وتحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته حيث انه يتميز بالعلاقة الجيدة مع الاهل وهو متكفل بكل ما يلزممهم فهو يتميز في العمل بالخبرة والمهارة ولكن ما يعيق تقدمه بالعمل هو رأس المال القليل حتى يتمكن من تقدم في العمل وتطوير ذاته ماديا واجتماعيا له زبائن من المحيط والجوار يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة رابيد للمساعدة في العمل وشراء معدات جديدة لتوسيع العمل فهو طموح يريد ان يبني مستقبل جيد وان يؤسس لعائلة مترابطة على اساس مادي جيد
texts.en: Youssef is 22 years old and unmarried. He works in the home tile business. He has seven years of experience in this field. He is trying to develop his business and improve his financial situation and social status, as well as the financial situation and social status of his family, as he has a very good relationship with his family and provides them with all of their material needs. He stands out in his field due to his experience and skill; however, what is hindering his progress in his business is a lack of capital. He needs capital in order to progress in his business and develop himself financially and socially. He has customers from his community and his neighborhood. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy a truck (model "Rapid") to use in his work, as well as new equipment to expand his business. He is ambitious and wants to build a good future for himself, similarly as he wants to start a close-knit family on a strong financial foundation.

loans.use: buy a truck (model "Rapid") with which he can transport the tiles and equipment he uses in his home tile business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna S. lives in Yerevan together with her husband and son. Susanna’s son is a student. Susanna runs a bakery in the city and her husband helps her by delivering the bread to the shops. Susanna would like to develop her business and increase her working capital. She plans to make a bulk purchase of raw ingredients for the bakery. The loan will help Susanna increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en: Norayr S. lives in Goris together with his wife, mother and two daughters. He is engaged in agriculture. Norayr wants his daughters to receive a higher education, but his current financial resources are not enough for that. Norayr plans to increase his livestock and develop agriculture. With the requested loan, he plans to buy two cows. With the loan’s help, Norayr will increase his income and will be able to pay for his daughters’ education.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.ar: محمد متزوج وهو اب لولد يعمل منذ 9 سنوات في سنترال للاتصالات يحب عمله وهو متجدد فيه ويطوره بشكل مستمر يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة للسنترال وتحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له زبائن من اصدقاء وجيران اقارب له بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تعيق تقدمه في العمل حيث انه بحاجة الى رأس المال كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد في تحسين العمل وتطوير الذات وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من الاسرة محمد اب حنون يحب اولاده ويريد ان يؤمن لهم كل ما يلزم من تعليم ومستلزمات الحياة اليومية
texts.en: Mohammad is married, and his is the father of one child. He has worked for the past nine years in a communications store. He likes his work, and in addition, he likes to continuously improve his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new equipment for his store in order to improve his financial situation and social status. He has customers from among his friends, neighbors and relatives, but he is having some material difficulties which are hindering him from progressing in his business. Specifically, he is in need of capital. He last loan from al-Majmoua had a positive impact on his business and helped him to develop himself, and he received the full support of his family during it. Mohammad is a caring father who loves his children, and he wants to secure for them everything that they need including an education and all of their every-day needs.

loans.use: buy new equipment for his communications store.

loans.name: C1912 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 31 years old.  She is married with two children aged between 6 months and 2 years.  She runs a small, well-organized store where she sells milk from 8am until 6pm every weekday. She has been operating her business successfully for two years. 

Eugenie is the leader of this group, called "DUFATANYE" in the local language, which means "to be together." She is the second person on the left.  The group consists of six women, all of whom have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase milk for their markets.  This loan will allow them all to provide better service to their customers, and to earn more profits. With this extra income they all earn, Eugenie and her group hope to save money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badenya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de poissons, de tubercules et de galettes.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des poissons, des tubercules et de la farine de blé.                                                                        
LALA C. compte acheter des poissons avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are all married women who average 28 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell fish, tubers, and flat cakes. This is their first group loan, which they will use to buy fish, tubers, and wheat flour.

LALA C. intends to buy fish from resellers in Fana. She conducts her sales daily, for cash or credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments, to pay contributions for social ceremonies, and to reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي رجل اعزب يعيش في منطقة من بعلبك اسمها العين يعمل في بيع الابقار والاغنام واللحوم له في عمله 14 سنة يحب العمل ويريد له التطور الكامل فهو مجد مكد يري العمل بشكل متطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ابقار واغنام وماكنة للحليب ما يعيق العمل ان يتطور هو عدم وجود رأس المال له خبرة في عمله حتى يطوره يتمتيز بعدم وجود منافس له في هذه المجال يحلم بأن يوسع عمله وان يؤمن نوعية جيدة لأبناء بلدته لأنه شخص ملتزم بالعمل
texts.en: Ali is unmarried and lives in an area in the Ba'albek region named Al-'Ain. He works selling cows, sheep and meat. He has 14 years of experience in his field, and he likes his work. He wants to fully develop his business, seeing as he is diligent and dedicated to his work. He runs his business very well. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy cows, sheep, and a milking machine. His lack of capital is what is hindering him from developing his business. He has much experience in his work, and he stands out in his field as he has no competitors. His dream is to expand his business and offer the residents of his town quality products seeing as he is committed to his work.

loans.use: buy cows, sheep and a milking machine for his business.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik V. lives with his wife and two children in Stepanavan city in the North of Armenia. 

Together with his wife, Rafik takes care of their small farm, consisting of cows, pigs, chickens and a horse. 

Rafik has applied for this loan to increase the livestock and expand the business in order to cover the family's daily costs and create more sustainable ground for his children's future.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de galettes et font de la restauration.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des céréales pour la préparation des galettes et du riz pour la restauration.                                                                        
YOROBO D. compte acheter  quelques colis de condiments alimentaires avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group, all married women or widows, are on the average 42 years old with six children. They all live in traditional extended family in the village of Nalla, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell food condiments and cookies and cook food for sale. 

The members of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity laon, which will be used to buy condiments, cereals for baking cookies and rice for preparing dishes for sale.Yorobo D. plans to purchase several packs of food condiments from resellers in Fana. She sells daily for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 12,500 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her costs of participating in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de poissons et de condiments.                                                                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
KONDIGUE D. compte acheter des articles divers de boutique (sucre, savon, pétrole etc.…) avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group, all married women or widows, are on the average 36 years old with  three children. They all live in traditional extended family in the village of N’Dosouma, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell various items, fish and condiments. The members of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity loan.

Kondigue D. plans to purchase various first-necessity items (sugar, soap, gasoline etc) from resellers in Fana. She sells daily out of her home, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 11,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her costs of participating in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various  items for resale

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de gâteaux, du lait et du haricot.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de la farine de blé, du lait et du haricot.                                                                          AMINATA T. compte acheter de la farine de blé avec les revendeurs au marché de Falako. Elle effectue ses ventes au village après préparation  des gâteaux, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 13000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, les frais de santé de ses enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkola are all married, and they average 35 years of age and three children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in cakes, milk, and bean. The group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy wheat flour, milk, and beans.

Ms. AMINATA T. plans on buying wheat flour from the retailers at the Falako market. She makes her sales in the village after making the cakes. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 13,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to cover the cost of health care for the children. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Ammar

texts.ar: عمار رجل اعزب عمره36 سنة يعيش في منطقة العين اللبنانية يعمل في بيع الادوات المنزلية والغذائية له في عمله 20 سنة كان للقرض السابق على حياته وحياة اسرته الاثر الجيد فقد قدمة له المجموعة من خلال القرض المحافظة على نمط حياة مستقرة في ظل ظروف صعبة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يتميز عمله بالجودة والدقة والشمولية في تنوع البضاعة وحسن المعاملة مع الزبائن يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ادوات منزلية ومواد غذائية وادوات خاصة بالمطاعم للموسم السياحي له زبائن من اكثر المناطق القريبة يواجه بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تعييق تطوير العمل يملك الخبرة الواسعة في هذا المجال ويسعى ان يكور نفسه وعمله بشكل اكبر وهو في طور تأسيس عائلة
texts.en: Ammar is 36 years old and unmarried. He lives in the Al-Ain region of Lebanon. He works selling home and kitchen appliances. He has 20 years of experience in this line of work.
