His last loan had a positive impact on his and his family's life. Through a loan from al-Majmoua he was able to maintain a stable lifestyle during difficult times. He received the full support of his family during his last loan. His business stands out in its field due to the quality of his products, his attention to detail, the comprehensive variety of his inventory, and his good dealings with his customers. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy homes appliances, food items, and appliances especially for use in restaurants in order to prepare for the tourist season. He has customers from most of the areas nearby the location of his store. He is having some material difficulties which are hindering him from developing his business. He has wide-ranging experience in his field, and he strives to further develop himself and his business while he is in the stage of his life when he will soon be starting a family.

loans.use: buy food items and appliances for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ten bales of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benso, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de savon, de condiments et de couscous.                                                                                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Benso sont à leur premier prêt. 
La cliente MARATOU D. compte acheter des savons avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7500 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Benso group are married women and widows. They average 36 years of age and five children each, and they all live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell soap, condiments, and couscous.

This is the Benso group’s first loan. Maratou D. plans to buy soap from resellers in Fana. She conducts her sales for cash or credit to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 7,500 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments, to pay contributions to social ceremonies, and to reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide, des fruits et du tiéké.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouman sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’arachide, des fruits et du tiéké.                                                                        
La cliente FATOUMATA C. compte acheter de l’arachide avec les revendeurs. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, de la nourriture pour les enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Dembagnouman group are all married, average 37 years of age with three children each and live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They met each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They all trade in peanuts, fruits and "tiéké" (a cassava-based food).

The women in the Dembagnouman group are on their first solidarity loan which will be used to buy peanuts, fruit and "tiéké". 

The customer, Fatoumata C. is planning to buy peanuts from retailers. She sells her products in the village square for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs which will be used to make her loan repayments and to buy food for her children. The balance will be reinvested in her trading activity.

loans.use: to by peanuts

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Deme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de poissons et de condiments.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Deme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des articles divers, des  poissons et des condiments.                                                                        
RAMATOU D. compte acheter du lait avec les éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Deme group are all married; on average, they are 28 years old with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of N’Dosouma in Fana subprefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through family relations, neighbors and friends. They trade in miscellaneous items, fish, and condiments. The women of the Deme group are requesting their first solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase various items, fish, and condiments.

RAMATOU D. is planning on purchasing milk from cattle farmers in the village and its vicinity. She retails daily, for cash and credit, to a customer base comprising both men and women.
She is planning on making an average monthly benefit of 10,000 CFA francs, to be used to pay back the loan and contribute to social ceremony expenses; the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tabac, d’articles divers et de poissons.                                                                                                                            
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du tabac, des articles divers et des  poissons.              
TENIN F. compte acheter du tabac  avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses des enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group, all married women or widows, are on the average 38 years old, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of N’Dosouma, Sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell tobacco, various first-need items and fish.
The members of the Djekafo group are on the first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy tobacco, various first-need items and fish.

Tenin F., plans to buy tobacco from the wholesalers in Fana. She sells locally in her village and in the nearby areas, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 7,500 West African francs, which will be used to pay off her loan and provide for the needs of her children, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy tobacco (for resale)

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 39 years old and the mother of three. Her husband, John, is a businessman. 

Harriet runs a grocery shop in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last five years. This marks her third borrowing from KADET, and she plans to add stock of potatoes, fruits, tomatoes, onions and cabbage into her business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business and repayment of the loan.

Her dream is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add stock of potatoes, fruits, tomatoes, onions and cabbage

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, composé de  mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 25 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de tubercules et font la tresse.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des tubercules et des petits matériels  pour la tresse.                                                                        
La cliente NANA D., qui se trouve être la présidente du groupe, compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs de Falako et souvent à Fana, pour les revendre au niveau du village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group, either married or widowed, are on average 25 years old with 3 children, living in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They met through connections with friends, family and neighbors. 

The women trade in condiments and root vegetables and  they also braid hair. They are on their first group loan, which will be used to buy condiments, root vegetables and small accessories for braids. Nana D., the group's president, plans to buy condiments from sellers in Falako as well as in Fana, to re-sell in her village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs which will be used to repay loan installments, pay contributions towards social ceremonies and the rest will be re-invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 41-year-old single mother of one child.

Mary runs a clothing business in Kiembeni. She has been in this business for the last year. 

This marks her first loan from KADET Ltd.  She plans to purchase curtains and bed sheets to add into her business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business and repayment of the loan.

Her dream is to have a bigger stall with a variety of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase curtains and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma M. is 57 years old and the single mother of three. 

Fatuma runs a café in Likoni. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. 

This marks her second loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase packets of wheat flour, rice, sugar, tea leaves and cooking oil for her business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business. 

Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase packets of wheat flour, rice, sugar, tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Maria Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL LAS ROSAS D. MARIA

La señora Armandina se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y ocurrente, ella es presidenta D. la alcancia comunal LAS ROSAS D. MARIA, elegida por ser carismaticay tratable, ella tiene su bodeguita en su casa y tambien venD. hielo, el cual reparte a pedido D. sus clientes por su zona, ella usara el prestamo para la compra D. mercaderia para su bodega y asi satisfacer mejor los pedidos D. sus clientes, ella sueña con hacer crecer su negocio D. la bodega.
La alcancia comunal LAS ROSAS D. MARIA tiene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por un año, se caracteriza por ser un grupo alegre y unido, pues todas son vecinas que intentan sacar a sus familias adelante con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Las Rosas D. Maria Community Bank.

Armandina is noted for being very cheerful and witty.  She is the president of the Las Rosas D. Maria community bank and was chosen because she is very charismatic and easy to get on with.  Armandina has a small grocery store in her home and she also sells ice which she delivers to order to customers in her area.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise for her store, so that she can better satisfy her customers' requests.  Armandina dreams of growing her grocery store business.

The Las Rosas D. Maria community bank has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for one year.  They are noted for being a cheerful and united group as they are all neighbors who are trying to get their families ahead in life through their work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
Jean Nepomuscene is 38 years old and is married with one 2 year old child. He sells various goods such as: lotion, soap, sugar, tea bags etc and has been in this business for 7 years. He works from 7am to 9pm every day and currently employs one person to help him.

He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of buying more goods to sell like: lotion, soap, sugar, tea bags, biscuits, soft drinks, Colgate etc. With more inventory, Jean Nepo will be able to earn more profit. This will allow him to save in future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell such as: lotion, soap, sugar, tea bags etc.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de poissons, de condiments et de tubercules.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur premier prêt et la SITAN C. qui est du groupe compte acheter des poissons avec les revendeurs de Fana pour les revendre quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Kotognontala is a group composed of married women and a widow. The group members average 29 years of age and three children each all living in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, sub-prefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro  (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship, and they do commerce in fish, condiments, and tubers. The group members are on their first loan.

Ms. SITAN C., who is in the group, plans on using her loan to buy fish from retailers in Fana for resale on a daily basis. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help pay for societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Nueva Amistad De Huascar Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR

Clemencia es una persona muy trabajadora que ha conseguido todo lo que tiene gracias a su propio esfuerzo y trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de artesania, las cuales algunas las compras y otras ella misma las produce, tambien ha enseñado a sus hijas este negocio, ahora cada una de ellas elabora sus propios productos, Clemencia usara el prestamo para comprar insumos y materiales para sus artesania, y sueña con ver su negocio mas grande, incluso desea exportar sus productos y hacer que sus productos sean conocidos

Clemencia es tesorera de la alcancia comunal NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR, cuyo nombre es porque son vecinas y han mostrado union, solidaridad entre ellas, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por 5 años, y cada quien en su respectivo negocio ha decidido crecer y ser mas productivo.
texts.en:
NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR [New Friendship of Huascar] COMMUNITY BANK 

Clemencia is a hardworking person who has obtained everything she has thanks to her hard work and effort. She sells artisanal crafts. She buys some of them and makes some of them herself. She has also taught her daughters this business and now each of them makes her own products. Clemencia will use the loan to buy materials for her artisanal crafts. She dreams of seeing her business grow. She even wants to export her products and have them be well known. 

Clemencia is the treasurer of the NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR community bank. Its name is due to the fact that the members are neighbors and they have shown themselves to be close and supportive to each other. They have worked with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for 5 years. Each person in her respective business has decided to grow and be more productive.

loans.use: to buy materials for artisanal crafts

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 23 years old.  She is married with one child who is two years old. She sells second-hand men’s, women’s and children’s clothes from 8am until 9pm every day. She has 2 years experience in her business.

Vestine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more clothes to sell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old.  She is married with one child, who is 14 years old, and one dependent relative. She has been running a pub for the past year.  She works from 8am until 11pm every day.

Flora has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying new materials like tables, glasses, a fridge and more beer - like Primus - and so on. With this expansion, she hopes to earn more profits than before. This will enable her to buy her own house, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy new materials like tables, glasses, a fridge and more beer, and so on

loans.name: Siyaphambili Group

texts.en:
Sithembile M. is the leader of the Siyaphambile group. She is 50 years old , married and has three children, aged 26, 23 and 17. One of the children is attending school. 

She is a cross-border trader who sells doilies, seat covers, African attire and bedspreads out of Zimbabwe but within the southern Africa region. She has been operating this business for the past nine years. She also gets extra income for the family from her farming activities and from her husband, who is a driver in Botswana.

Sithembile has requested this loan through MicroKing to purchase raw material (poly cotton, Java fabric, satin fabric, foam rubber, sheeting and mendy material) to make seat covers, bedspreads and African attire. 

Her only challenges are the limits on goods to export and import and also hassles she goes through on crossing the border. However, she sees the extra income from this loan increasing her disposable income and improving her family's health and general upkeep. 

She envisions herself owning a boutique and employing people. 

Sithembile is thankful of the support being given to women.
 
Note: In the picture Sithembile is sitting.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (poly cotton, Java fabric, satin fabric, foam rubber, sheeting and mendy material) to make seat covers, bedspreads and African attire.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. Rose sells mobile phones. Her business is well-organized. Rose has three years experience and she works from 8am until 9pm every day. 

Rose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more mobile phones to sell. With this loan, Rose expects to create new business that will allow her to save for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Women Of Excellency Group

texts.en:
Jean C. is the leader of the Women of Excellency group. She is a 33 years old and the mother of a school-going child, aged 10. Jean is divorced. 

She is a cross-boarder trader who gets clothes from South Africa and sells them near Gweru, Zimbabwe. She has been running this business since 2006 and sells the clothes in Shurugwi, a remote area that is approximately 33 km away from Gweru town. She also gets some income from a maintenance allowance being paid by her ex-husband. Her main challenges are lack of funding and changing government regulations.   

Jean requested this loan through MicroKing for the purpose of purchasing clothes from South Africa. She says that the extra income from this loan will have a positive impact on her business and family. 

In the future she would like to open a bigger shop in Shurugwi. 

In the photo, Jean is sitting.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 42 years old and married, with two children who are 14 and 19 years old. She also takes care of three children who are between 14 and 22 years old.  Francoise sells sacks of charcoal in her store. Her business is well-organized. She has two years of experience in her business and she works from 5:30 A.M. until 9 P.M. every day except Sunday. She currently employs two people to help her.

Francoise has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell, so she can improve her business. With the extra profit, Francoise will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 33 years old and married, with three children who range in age from 2 to 9 years. She sells milk in her business. Her business is well-organized. She has one year of experience in her business and she works from 5 A.M. until 10 P.M. every day. Angelique currently employs two people to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of milk to sell. With the profit, Angelique will reinvest in her business and will be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of milk.

loans.name: Lampard Group

texts.en:
Desolery F. is in her early 30s and married with children. She has been running a general store business for six years. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Desolery's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the shop stock and also bought a motorcycle. She paid back her loan successfully.  

She hopes for a new loan to increase the shop inventory. Her dream is buy another motorcycle for carrying people, like a taxi.

Desolery will share this loan with her loan group "Lampard," which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture Desolery is first person on the left in the first row.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her general store.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is 36 years old and is married, with three children between the ages 12 and 22 years old as well as three other dependent relatives. Anitha has been running a pub for the past 5 years. This business is well organized. She employs 11 people to help her. Anitha works from 6am until 10pm every day.

Anitha has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company, s.a, in order to expand her business by buying more beer, like Primus, wisque, mitsing and so on. With an expansion, Anitha hopes to increase her profits. With this increase, she will be able to buy her own house, create a Hotel, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beer for her pub, such as riquer, wisque, and so on.

loans.name: Amanda Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Amanda es una señora de 27 años está casada con el señor Alba Jhasmany juntos tienen una hija de 9 años, la cual asiste a una escuela de primaria, Amanda vive en la comunidad de la maica sud , vive en la casa de sus padres , ya que la casa de ella aún está en construcción , los padres le heredaron el terreno y ahí es donde está haciendo construir , actualmente viven los tres tan solo en  una habitación , donde todos están muy incomodos , la principal actividad de la señora Amanda es la venta de comida ( chicharrón de cerdo, que es un plato tipico de la zona , pato , conejo, etc. ) , todos los fin de semanas a partir de viernes hasta el lunes , y el esposo trabaja como taxista todos los días , de esta manera los dos trabajan todos los días para terminar la construcción de su casa , el préstamo será destinado para la compra de un cerdo para la preparación de chicharrón , ya que le ha faltado capital para seguir cocinando.

Ella lo mejor que hace es cocinar así que entre sus sueños y metas esta, que en futuro tener un restaurant grande donde ella pueda preparar sus exquisitos platos.
texts.en:
Amanda is 27 years old and she is married with Mr. Alba Jhasmany and they have a 9-year old daughter together. She is in primary school. Amanda lives in the community of La Maica Sud. She lives in her parents' house because her own house is still under construction. Her parents inherited her land where she is building. The three of them live in a single room and they are all very uncomfortable. Amanda's main business is food sales (pork rinds, a traditional food of the region, and duck, rabbit, etc.). She sells during the weekends from Friday to Monday. Her husband works every day as a taxi driver. They both work every day to finish building their house. The loan will be destined to purchase a pig to make pork rinds. She has not had capital funds to keep up her food sales.

The best thing she knows how to do is to cook and among her dreams and goals is to have a great restaurant in the future where she will be able to prepare her delicious recipes.

loans.use: to purchase a pig for her catering business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter G. K. is married to Lucy Njeri and they have three children. The wife is a farmer.

For eight years, Peter has been running a green grocery store in which he sells a variety of vegetables and gets an income of KES 9,220 per month. 

This is his third loan from KADET Ltd. and he paid back the previous loans successfully. He intends to use the loan amount to buy more green groceries such as cabbages, spinach, potatoes and various greens for sale. The anticipated profit he will use to start a retail shop.

In the future, he plans to grow his business and open a supermarket in Mutego shopping center.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, cabbages, spinach and various greens for sale.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 22 and 31. Marthe sells various goods in her store, such as napkins, soft drinks, cosmetics, etc. Her business is well organized. She has one year's experience in her business. She opens her business from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. every day except on Saturday. Marthe currently employs two people to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods to sell, like napkins, soft drinks, and cosmetics, in order to improve her business. With this profit, Marthe will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell, such as napkins, soft drinks, and cosmetics

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 31 years old and is married with one child of his own and two more whom he takes care of. Fidel owns a paper mill where he sells different kinds of books. His business is well known, as well as organized. He employs one person as a helper and has two years of experience in this work. 

Fidel has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more kinds of books to sell. This will help him to satisfy his many customers. Fidel will be able to earn more profits, which can be reinvested in his business, and he will save for his future.

loans.use: To expand his paper mill.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire, age 43, has a general store business where she sells such items as water, body lotion, and soap. Her business is well-organized and she employs two people to help her. Her business opens at 6 a.m. and closes at 8 p.m. every day. She has one year of experience. She and her husband have nine children between the ages of 10 and 24 years old.
 
Marie Claire has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products to offer for sale in her store. With the profits, Marie Claire plans to save for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase such items as water, body lotion, and soap to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Jean Robert

texts.en:
Jean Robert, age 29, works as a technician. He starts his work from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday. He has been in this business for two years and currently employs two people to help him. He is married without children.
 
He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more materials for his business. With the profits generated as a result of this loan, Jean Robert will be able to earn more revenue, which will allow him to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 40, has operated a general store business for about one year. Her store offers such items as rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, water, juice, and cosmetics. She and her husband have no children but support one dependent relative. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Agnes has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products to offer for sale in her store. With the profits, she plans to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 45 years old and married, with 6 children of her own between the ages 7 and 17 years old and one orphan whom she adopted.  Cecile owns an Internet cafe, located in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali.  She also does paid secretarial work for customers of her Internet cafe. Rwanda is becoming a communications hub for East and central Africa, so most people there use the Internet.

Cecile has requested a loan from Kiva in order to buy more paper, files, ink for her printers, etc.  With the additional profits from this, Cecile will reinvest in her business and renovate her house.  Her dream is to buy more computers for her growing business.

loans.use: To buy more paper and ink for her printers in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe una hombre soltero de 33 años de edad que vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona urbano marginal, contando con los servicios de agua y luz solamente; en el departamento de Cajamarca,la cual se encuentra a una distancia de 6 horas de la provinciade Chiclayo.  Este departamento se caracteriza por ser una ciudad turística a nivel internacional, por sus ricos platos típicos, por sus festividades y costumbres de su gente y por ser una zona minera.

Desde hace varios años Noe se dedica al comercio de diferentes tipos de papa junto con su padre  ya que es un negocio altamente rentable.  La papa es un producto consumido a nivel nacional e internacional por ser agradable y  sus diferentes usos en las comidas tanto en distintos restaurantes como en las casas de los pobladores, por lo cual le permitiría a Noe aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

Por lo mismo Noe a solicitado un préstamo  de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para poder seguir comprando el producto y venderlo al por mayor y menor en en los distintos mercados del departamento de Cajamarca como a otros departamentos, para seguir incrementando sus ventas y de paso hacerse mas conicido en los distintos lugares que vende por tener un producto de calidad.

Noe es conocido en los distintos mercados por ser un hombre bueno, trabajador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante para poder darles lo que deseen a sus padres y mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
Noe is a single man who is 33 years old and he lives in his parents' house, located in a suburban region. They have only have water and hydro services. They live in the department of Cajamarca and it is located 6 hours from the province of Chiclayo. This department is known as a tourist town at the international level for its delicious traditional foods, its festivals and culture, and for being a mining region.

Noe has been a merchant for several years, selling all types of potatoes with his father. The business is highly successful. Potatoes are a product that is consumed nationally and internationally for its taste and for the different uses in foods, in both restaurants and the homes of the population. This will permit Noe to increase his earnings and to cover his daily expenses.

For this reason Noe has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to be able to keep purchasing the product and reselling it in wholesale and retail at the various markets in the department of Cajamarca and other departments. He will increase his sales and he will become well known in the various locales where he sells for having quality products.

Noe is well known at the different markets for being a decent, hardworking man who is eager to succeed to be able to give his parents whatever they need and to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy various types of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu, age 32 and married, has owned a motorcycle transport business for the past twelve years. His business is well-organized and open daily from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. 
  
Jean De Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy essential materials like tires for his motorcycle transport. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to buy essential materials like tires for his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee, age 45, owns and operates a well-organized general store business where she sells goods such as lotions, soap, rice, bread, and sugar. She has 15 years of experience in her business and works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day except Saturday. Immaculee currently employs two people to help her. She and her husband have five children between the ages of three and 22 years old .

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand the inventory of her boutique. She will be purchasing different goods to sell, such as salt, beans, soft drinks, and radios. With the profit, Immaculee will reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: to expand her store inventory with such items as salt, beans, and soft drinks

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Ollantaytambo  y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan De La Cruz; es casado; el socio tiene 38 años de edad; el tiene 2 hijos, de 15 y 7 años de edad; el socio es presidente del banco comunal; tiene como principal actividad la administración de su botica, en ella vende medicamentos, el socio junto a su esposa trabajan en la botica del pueblo, el socio también trabaja en turismo con su transporte haciendo traslados de turistas de Ollantaytambo a Urubamba y Cusco y viceversa. El socio tiene el trabajo con turistas de manera eventual, esto cuando hay temporada alta de turistas, pero por lo general el está atendiendo la botica con su esposa, el socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de medicamentos y de este modo ampliar su capacidad de venta.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Ollantay de Wayracpuncu" is located in the province of Ollantaytambo and in the department of Cusco.

The name of this member is Mr. Juan de la Cruz. He is married, 38 years old, and he has 2 children, aged 15 and 7. He is the president of the communal bank. His primary business activity is his pharmacy store where he sells medications. He and his wife run the pharmacy of the village. He also works in tourism with a transport vehicle, providing tourist transportation in Ollantaytambo, from Urubamba to Cusco and vice versa. He works in the tourism business occasionally, mostly during the tourist season. But more commonly he works with his wife in their pharmacy. He requires a loan to invest in the purchase of medications so to increase his sales capacity.

He is very thankful for the loan and he is committed to making the payments of the loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase medications for his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jeronima; ella tiene 55 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. crianza D. animales y también tiene una tierra D. cultivo donD. siembra papa, habas y maíz y luego lo venD. en las distintas ferias del distrito D. Anta, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. crianza D. animales y agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales y para comprar semillas para las tierras D. cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion-Anta". The communal bank is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta in the deparment of Cusco.

Her name is Jeronima. She is 55 years old, married, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her livestock business and she also has farm land where she cultivates potatoes, fava beans, and corn. She later sells the products at the different fairs in the district of Anta. She wants to expand and to improve her livestock business and her agriculture business. She requests a loan to purchase feed for the livestock and to purchase seeds to her farm land.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock and seeds to cultivate on her farm land.

loans.name: Leonce

texts.en:
Leonce is 35 years old and is married with two children of his own, ages 4 and 7 years, and three adopted children. He makes a living as the owner of a clothing store.  His business is well organized, and he employs one person to help him. Leonce has ten years' experience and works from 8am until 8pm every day.
 
Leonce's business is currently too small to satisfy his customers. To remedy this, he has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. in order to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell. He hopes to increase the number of his customers as well his profits. If successful, Leonce will save for the future and  satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teccia

texts.es:
Teccia forma parte del banco comunal “Newen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Penco. 
Ella se dedica a vender artículos de confitería, tabaquería y heladería en un bazar, éste local lo arrienda en el centro de la ciudad de Concepción. Teccia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 7 años. Sin embargo las ventas en general han disminuido, lo que es desfavorable para su negocio, en la actualidad vende sus productos sólo para comprar mercadería diariamente.
Su mercadería la compra directamente a proveedores, supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras.
Con el préstamo comprará helados, cigarrillos y mercadería de confitería. 
Sus metas en su negocio son abastecer su bazar de mercadería, sin embargo para concretar éste proyecto es necesario contar con mayores ingresos para poder invertir.  
Teccia vive junto a unas tías y su hermana mayor. Ella educó a sus sobrinos, ya que su hermana se cambió de domicilio.
Su sueño es viajar y conocer el extranjero (ciudades y países fuera de Chile).
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son para ayudar a sus sobrinos socioeconómicamente.
Teccia está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y apoyo otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, además a través de las reuniones, ha conocido personas muy agradables y ha logrado compartir experiencias. Respecto a los cursos impartidos en cada reunión ha reforzado sus conocimientos en ventas lo que ha logrado integrar en la gestión y operación de su negocio de manera favorable.
Penco es una comuna cercana a la ciudad de Concepción, al sur de Chile, región del Bíobío. Su nombre  viene del mapudungun y significa "agua de peumo". Es una de las comunas con mayor cantidad de habitantes en la región. Cuenta con centros industriales y un puerto.
texts.en:
Teccia is a member of the communal bank named "Newen" in the city of Penco. 

She sells pastries, tobacco products, and ice cream from a store. She rents this store and it is located in the downtown area of the city of Concepcion. Teccia has been in this business for 7 years. Her sales in general have declined and it is a challenge for her business. The profit she earns from the sale of her products is only enough to purchase her daily merchandise.

She purchases her merchandise directly from providers, wholesale markets and distributors. With this loan she will purchase ice cream, cigarettes, and pastry products. Her goal for her business is to supply her store with merchandise. But in order to meet her objective she needs to have greater income with which to reinvest.

Teccia lives with one of her aunts and her eldest sister. She sent her nieces and nephews to school when her sister changed address. 

Her dream is to travel and to see other countries (cities and countries outside of Chile). 

Her motivation to keep up her business rests on helping her nieces and nephews socio-economically. Teccia is very happy and very thankful for the loan and for the support granted to her by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner). She has also gotten to know very friend people through the meetings and she has been able to share experiences. With respect to the training provided at each meeting it has helped her reinforce her knowledge of sales. She has managed to successfully integrate this knowledge into the management and operation of her business. 

Penco is a nearby community to the city of Concepcion in southern Chile, in the region of Biobio. The name comes from the Mapudungun language, meaning "Peumo water". (Peumo is a tree native to Chile). It is one of the largest communities in the region, having industrial centers and a sea port.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, cigarettes, and pastry products.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, du lait et de gâteaux.                                                                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur premier prêt.                                                                        
KAFOUNE F. compte acheter des patates douces avec les revendeurs de la ville de Fana pour les revendre sur place au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala group are all married. On average, they are 32 years old with 4 children, and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of N"Dosouma, sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women met through connections with family, friends and neighbors.

They trade in root vegetables, milk and cakes, and are on their first loan. Kafoune F. plans to buy sweet potatoes from sellers in the town of Fana to re-sell them locally for cash and on credit to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 6,500 CFA francs which will be used to pay loan installments, pay contributions to social ceremonies and the rest will be re-invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de pâte d’arachide, de galettes, de condiments alimentaires et de savons.                                                                                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’arachide, du mil, des condiments et du savon.                                                                        
SIRADJE F. compte acheter de l’arachide avec les revendeurs sur place et dans les environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place après transformation en pâte d’arachide au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en: The women of the Sabougnouma group are all married with a mean age of 29 and an average of three children.  They all live in traditional families in the village of N'Dosouma, under the prefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They met through family relationships, neighbors and friendships.  They sell peanut butter, pastries, condiments and soaps.  The women of the Sabougnouma group are in their first joint loan which will be used to purchase peanuts, millet, condiments and soap.  Siradje F. plans to purchase peanuts with the resellers both locally and in the surrounding areas.  She makes her sales daily after processing them into into peanut butter and she accepts both cast and credit from a clientele composed primarily of women.  She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA which she will be use to make her loan payments and social ceremony contributions and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de condiments, de céréales et du pain.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des tubercules, des condiments, des céréales et du pain.                                                                         
La cliente ADIARRATOU D. compte acheter des tubercules (igname) avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses familiales, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouman group, all married women, are on the average 33 years old with   four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of  Nalla, Sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell yams, condiments, cereals and bread. The members of the   Sabougnouman group are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase yams, condiments, cereals and bread.

Adiarratou D. plans to buy yam tubers from resellers in Fana. She sells daily in her village, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 10,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan, pay for some family expenses, and cover her costs of participating in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la costureria y también administra una tienda, vive con sus dos hijos y un nieto, trabaja de costurera con las escuelas, confeccionando los uniformes escolares, también tiene el negocio en su propia casa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar frijoles, azúcar, arroz, pan, jabón, para la tienda, estos materiales son demandados por los clientes por tal motivo será una gran ayuda disponer de ellos.
Ella quiere ayudar a sus hijos para que realicen su vida, también tener una fuente de ingreso constante para un largo plazo.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in San Francisco Gotera in the deparment of Morazan. She is a seamstress and she also runs a store. She lives with her two children and a grandson. She works as a seamstress for the schools, making school uniforms. She runs the business form her own home. She requests a loan to purchase beans, sugar, rice, bread, and soap for her store. These products are in demand by her clients which is why it will be a great help to have a supply of them.

She wants to help her children to build a life for themselves and she also wants to have a steady source of income for the long term.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, rice, bread, and soap for her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a kneading machine, additional baking oven, wood and supplies.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz, natural de la ciudad de Palmapampa de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Rómulo de 39 años y sus 07 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor provenir. Beatriz y su pareja son el sostén de sus hijos, ella desde muy niña trabajó en las tierras de sus padres y hoy es toda una conocedora de la labor que realiza en el campo, es campesina y cuenta con 05 hectáreas de terreno cultivado con café, barbasco y plátano, plantas nativas de la zona selvática. Ha trabajado durante 10 años en esta actividad y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez la extracción de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; asimismo no cuenta con suficiente ingreso económico, para que pueda solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros, quienes le ayudan en la cosecha; es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno por cultivar. Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas y desmonte de malezas.
texts.en: Beatriz is originally from the city of Palmapampa. She is 37 years old and she is a very hardworking woman. She lives in a house that she owns together with her husband, Romulo, 39 years old, and their 7 beloved children, to whom she wants to provide a better future. Beatriz and her partner are the support for their children. Since she was a very young girl she worked the land with her parents and today she is an expert in agriculture. She is a farmer and she has 5 hectares of land where she cultivates coffee, barbasco (an inedible shrub that is used to stun fish), and bananas. These are native plants to the jungle region. She has been working in this business for 10 years and during the harvest she has her children's support and that of farm hands to quickly collect the products. What she most enjoys about her work is the harvest. This is when she feels that the months of arduous work are rewarded with the quality of the product. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport the products from the fields to the collection centers in the city of San Francisco. She also struggles with an insufficient income to cover the advance payments to the farm hands that help with the harvest. This is why she requests a loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). But her priority now is to plant more coffee plants. She has 2 hectares of land that are ready to cultivate. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she says that the funds from this loan will help her a great deal in the progress of her business. She is very well liked by the other members of the communal bank. With the 2000 nuevos soles that she requests she will hire farm hands to provide her with the help that she needs with the harvest and to combat against plagues.

loans.use: to hire farm hands to help her with the harvest and to combat against plagues.

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en:
Nasrin lives in the Negev. She is a 25-year-old mother of four. She owns a small beauty salon for make-up and waxing and now is expanding to bridal rentals, nail extensions and manicures.

Nasrin needed this loan to purchase bridal dresses for rental and beauty salon supplies.

In the future Nasrin wants to open a large bridal salon in the center of her village and employ part-time staff to assist her.

loans.use: To purchase bridal dresses for rental and beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wool, cloth and thread as well as additional gifts for customers to purchase.

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de condiments et de tubercules.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.  MAH C. compte acheter des habillements avec les grossistes de Fana pour les revendre sur place au village et dans les environnants au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  15000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses liés à ses enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguidolo group are all married women who average 41 years of age and six children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another as neighbors, and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell clothing, condiments, and tubers. This is their first group loan. 
MAH C. plans to buy clothing from Fana wholesalers for resale on site at the village and in surrounding areas, for cash or credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments and to cover expenses incurred for the children. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de kiosco escolar donde vende sándwich, dulces, gaseosas y galletas y los días sábados y domingos la socia vende papa y haba en la ciudad de Cusco en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de kiosco escolar y negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el kiosco escolar.            
                                       
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion-Anta". It is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and to the department of Cusco.

Her name is Juana. She is 49 years old, married, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her school canteen business. She sells sandwiches, sweets, soft drinks, and cookies every week day. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells potatoes and fava beans in the city of Cusco itinerantly. She wants to expand and to improve her school canteen business and her vegetable business. She requests a loan to purchase products for her canteen.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase products for her school canteen business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la fabricación de hamacas y matatas, al mismo tiempo trabaja de ordenanza, vive junto a sus 6 hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para preparar hamacas, como hilo de seda, cáñamo y manguillos, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar su producción aumentarla para ofrecer a los clientes.
Ella tiene como objetivo el proveer a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que se superen, se esfuerza todos los días y espera un día verlos en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Martha lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazan. She makes hammocks and chairs and she is also an ordinance worker. She lives with her 6 children. 

She requests a loan to purchase materials to make hammocks, such as silk thread, wood canes, and cuffs. This loan will help her improve production and to increase what she can offer her clients.

Her objective is to provide her children with all that they need to success. She works hard every day and she hopes to see them in better condition one day.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks, such as silk thread, wood canes, and cuffs.

loans.name: Danitza Yovani

texts.es:
Danitza es una madre de familia de 28 años dedad que vive con su esposo y menores hijos en el distrito de Ferreqafe a  tan solo 30 minutos de distancia de la provincia de chiclayo, cuenta con una casa propia, con servicios de agua y luz ubicada en la zona rural de dicho distrito. Ferreqafe se caracteriza por ser unazona netamnente agricola y ganadera.

Danitza se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y es conocida por su vecinos porque ofrece sus productos de casa en casa.  Estos productos es para que las personas mejoren su imagen perosnal, en especial las mujeres y con esos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo económicamente.

A solicitado Danitza a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para mejorar el baño de su casa,y  mejorar la higiene y limpieza para su familia evitando todo riesgo de contraer alguna enfermedad.  Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos de belleza cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Danitza es una persona muy conocidad por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Danitza is a 28-year old mother who lives together with her husband and her young children in the district of Ferreqafe. It is located only 30 minutes from the province of Chiclayo. She owns her home and it is equipped with water and hydro, and it is situated in the rural region of the district. Ferreqafe is a strictly agricultural and farming region.

Danitza sells beauty products and she is well known to her neighbors because she sells her products form house to house. These products are used by individuals to improve their personal appearance, especially women. With her profits she is able to help support her children and she can help her husband financially.

Danitza has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to improve the bathroom in her house for better hygiene and cleanliness for her family. She wants to avoid any risk of contracting a disease. She will be able to cover the payments of her loan with the profits from the sale of her beauty products.

Danitza is a very well known to be a hardworking person who is responsible and who is a good mother. She wants to provide her children with a better future and to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to improve the bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría animales como gallinas, cuyes y ovejas, ella los hace engordar y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y para comprar animales.                          
                        
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta, departament of Cuzco.

This member's name is Marcelina. She is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of raising animals. She raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and sheep. She fattens them up and later sells them in the different fairs there are in the district of Anta. Marcelina is asking for the loan to buy feed for the animals and to buy animals.                         
                        
Marcelina is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals and to buy animals.

loans.name: Siguitemason Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguitemason, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de céréales et de tubercules.                                                                                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Siguitemason sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des  condiments, des céréales et des tubercules.                                                                        
La cliente SOK. T., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes avec les grossistes de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village et les environnants au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguitemason group are all married women, averaging 39 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, Sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoror Region (the second administrative region of Mali).They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell condiments, cereals and yams. The members of the Siguitemason group are on the first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy condiments, cereals and yams.

SoK. T., the group’s leader, plans to buy all sorts of food condiments from the wholesalers in Fana. She sells locally in her village and in the nearby areas, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 5,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay off her loan and cover the costs of her participation in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina, de 35 años, es una mujer  espontánea y trabajadora, convive con Roberto de 36 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. Ella desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra,  hoy es campesina, y con sus ahorros más el sueldo de su pareja compraron su propio terreno donde cultiva plantas de café, cacao, barbasco y hojas de coca. Esta actividad lo realiza todos los días, desde muy temprano dirigiéndose a trabajar en sus tierras, pues sabe que las ganancias obtengan por la venta de sus productos dependerá mucho de su esfuerzo. Su cosecha es trasladada desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde mejores precios recibe por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, sin embargo le es difícil trabajar en temporadas de lluvia, porque perjudican el rendimiento de su trabajo. En el futuro espera trabajar con la misma perseverancia que la caracteriza. Este es su  octavo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con el crédito comprará sacos de abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Enedina is 35 years old.  She is a spontaneous and hard-working woman who lives with 36 year-old Roberto and her three beloved children who she would like to provide with a good education. 

Since she was very young, Enedina's parents taught her to work on the farm.  She is now a farmer and, with her savings and her partner's wage, she bought her own plot of land where she grows coffee plants, cacao, barbasco and coca leaf.  Enedina carries out her work every day, from very early in the morning.  She goes out to work on her land since she knows that the profits she makes when she sells her products will depend a lot on her efforts.

Enedina transports her harvested crops from her community to the warehouse centers which are located in San Francisco. This is where she receives the best prices for her products.  What Enedina most enjoys about her work is harvesting since that is when she feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  In the future, Enedina hopes to work with the same perseverance that characterizes her now.  This is her eighth loan from MFP.  She says that this loan will help her greatly in making progress in her work.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  She will use her loan to buy sacks of manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY D. WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia D. Ollantaytambo  y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rogelia; es viuda; La socia tiene 60 años D. edad; ella tiene 4 hijos (35, 32, 28, 25) años D. edad, la socia tiene como principal actividad la ganadería, la socia cría animales especialmente vacas, la socia también venD. leche, ella también reparte la leche a un centro escolar, la socia se encarga D. la alimentación y cuidado D. las vacas, ella les da vitaminas, sales minerales y alimentación balanceada para procurar una excelente leche y mejorar su producción, la socia desea seguir en actividad y pese a que ahora es más cansado para ella su actividad diaria ella desea seguir con esto para sentirse viva y dar el ejemplo a sus hijos y a su comunidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. alimento para las vacas.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Rogelia is a member of the "Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu" community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo province, in Cusco department.

Rogelia is 60 years old and a widow.  She has four children aged 35, 32, 28 and 25.  Her main business activity is raising livestock.  She raises animals, especially cows.  She also sells milk.  She delivers her milk to a school.

Rogelia takes care of feeding and looking after her cows.  She gives them vitamins, mineral salts and balanced feed to obtain better milk and improve her production.  Rogelia would like to continue in this business and, despite  the fact that her daily work is becoming more tiring for her, she would like to continue so that she can feel alive and set a good example for her children and her community.

Rogelia is requesting this loan to invest in buying feed for her cows.  She is very grateful to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying feed for her cows

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ernestina; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras y también vende productos secos como trigo, moraya y cebada y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras y granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y granos secos.                                                

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción-Anta" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Ernestina is 70 years old, married, and has six children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling vegetables.  She also sells dried products such as wheat, 'moraya' (a freeze-dried potato product) and barley.  She sells her products in the different street markets that take place in Anta district.  She would like to expand her business selling vegetables and dried grains.

Ernestina is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and dried grains.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and dried grains

loans.name: Super Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Super, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de chaussures et pratiquent le maraîchage.                                                                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Super sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des chaussures et des semences pour le maraîchage.                                                                         
La cliente SITAN B. compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs de Falako pour revendre au village. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Super group, all married, are on average 35 years old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through connections with family, friends and neighbors. The women sell condiments and shoes. They also work as market gardeners.                                                                                                                              
The women of the Super group are on their first group loan which will be used to buy condiments, shoes and seeds for market gardening.                                                                         

Sitan B. plans to buy condiments from the sellers in Falako and re-sells in her village. She makes sales every day, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women.

Sitan expects to make an average monthly profit of 7,500 CFA francs which will be used to pay the loan installments, pay for contributions to social ceremonies and the rest will be re-invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Kelvin Isael

texts.es:
Kelvin, vive con sus padres, es agricultor, Residen en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz, sandia y venta de leche.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos y sembrar maíz, con este préstamo podrá adquirir tanto los cerdos como los insumos necesarios para el cultivo como abono y fertilizante.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente para ayudar a sus padres, ya que son su compañía y dependen de él.
texts.en:
Kelvin lives with his parents in San Carlos, in Morazán department.  He is a farmer.  He grows corn and watermelons, and also sells milk.

Kelvin is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs and to sow corn.  With this loan he will be able to buy pigs and also the supplies he needs to grow his crops such as manure and fertilizer.

Kelvin's goal is to work hard to help his parents since they are his company and they depend on him.

loans.use: to buy pigs, manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, rice and oil

loans.name: Soila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Ollantaytambo  y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soila; es viuda; La socia tiene 71 años de edad; ella tiene 6 hijos (todos ellos independientes), la socia tiene su abarrotes, la socia con cada préstamo implementa su tienda, ella requiere comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar, galletas, leche y de este modo surtir la tienda de abarrotes, la socia comprará los productos mencionados para esta nueva temporada. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de su tienda de abarrotes.
