She has a house of her own with all basic utilities (water, electricity and sewage) located in a rural zone of said province.  Tambogrande is noted for being a distinctly farming and livestock raising area.

Maribel refurbished her living room to accommodate a small store selling beauty products and all kinds of decorations.  She’s been in this activity for a little over two years.  The products are designed for the improvement of personal appearance.  She also stocks gifts for all occasions.  Income helps her and her husband support their children.

Maribel has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan to buy more beauty products and to stock her store with a different kind of merchandise, like clothes for all ages, because people in her district who buy from her have commented that it would be good for her to sell these kinds of things in her store too.  Income from the sale of all her products will cover her loan installments and improve her quality of life.

Maribel is very well known for being a hard working, cheerful, responsible woman and for being a good mother who wants to provide a better future for her loved ones (husband and children).

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and clothes for all ages.

loans.name: Dolores Alejandra

texts.es: Dolores Alejandra se dedica a la compra de mercadería en general. Tiene 31 años de tener esta actividad. Aprendió este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, Dolores tiene la necesidad de conseguir un trabajo que le brindara el sustento de su familia. Ofrece diferentes productos  como bolsos, calzado, ropa en general, perfumes, tratamientos, prendas y sabanas,  ya tiene mucha clientela pues su carisma y buen servicio atrae a las personas del lugar. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como  sabanas, calzado, perfumes, tratamientos, delantales, ropa interior, bolsos, prendas y otros productos.
texts.en:
Dolores Alejandra buys assorted merchandise.  She’s had this business for 31 years.  She learned this way of life because she needed to cover household expenses.  Dolores needs to find a job that will provide support for her family.  

She sells a variety of different products like: purses, footwear, clothing in general, perfume, hair treatments, items of clothing and bed sheets.  She has a lot of customers because her charisma and good service attracts locals.  

She is asking for this loan to buy stock merchandise like: bed sheets, footwear, perfume, hair treatments, aprons, underwear, purses, clothing items and other products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFATRERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara caldos, segundos y refrescos, ella trabaja en el mercado de confraternidad desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carnes, verduras y fideos.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, venta de sogas, venta de jugos, negocio de restaurant, servicio de taxi, artesanía  y venta de frutas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “URPIS DE CONFATRERNIDAD” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District which belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

Gregoria, 35, is the member.  She has a spouse and two children.  She works selling prepared food.  She makes soups, main dishes and beverages.  She works in the Confraternidad Market from 7am until 6pm.  She wants to raise her children through this work.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like: meats, vegetables and noodles.

The other group members’ businesses are: grocery sales, rope sales, juice sales, restaurant, taxi services, crafts and fruit sales.

The member thanks all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook like meats, vegetables and noodles.

loans.name: Blanca Edita

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor esta soltero y es el que vive con ella y estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual trabaja junto  a su esposo,  allí  venden  todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también venden carne, pollo, pescado y útiles escolares, los productos los compra en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos, ciertos productos los  recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 15 años con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años  y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre communal bank meets every two weeks in the San Clemente resort.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by local and foreign tourists alike.  It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional, regional dishes.

We found Blanca, 52, here.  She’s married and has three adult children.  The youngest is still single and lives with her.  He goes to the university.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a home based grocery store that she runs with her husband.  They sell all kinds of products like: rice, sugar, oil and detergents, among other things.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Besides these products they also sell meat, chicken, fish and school supplies.  They stock up in Portoviejo because they are less expensive there.  Certain products are delivered to her store.  She tells us that she’s been in business over 15 years.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need products.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the togetherness that exists in the group.  Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar and canned goods

loans.name: Zuleyka Alexandra

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

Aquí conocimos a Zuleika, tiene 20 años  de edad, esta soltera. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella estudia Auditoría en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí, está en el séptimo semestre. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por 8  ciclos, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta por que recibe ayuda a través de los créditos para tener su negocio y así poder seguir con sus estudios.

Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en un cibercafé y también se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo de la marca Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes  en las tardes ya que en las mañanas estudia, sus ventas las realiza en sus tiempos libres aunque también aprovecha para vender a sus compañeras y en el lugar donde trabaja, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos.

Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre communal bank meets every two weeks in the San Clemente resort.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by local and foreign tourists alike.  It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional, regional dishes.

We met Zuleika, 20, here.  He’s single living in her parents’ house.  She is majoring in Accounting at Manabí Technical University; she’s in her 7th semester.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 cycles and is the bank’s Secretary.  She likes it because she gets help through the loans to have a business of her own to thus be able to continue with her studies.

She works Monday through Friday at a Cybercafé and also sells Avon brand catalogue products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works Monday through Friday afternoons because she attends classes in the morning.  She does her sales in her spare time although she also avails herself of the opportunity to sell to her coworkers and classmates.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She tells us that she’s been doing this activity for two years and she does well.

This loan will be used to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams, among other products.  Her goals are to complete her studies and own her own business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS D. CONFATRERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. granos secos y también se dedica a la venta D. animales como ganados, cuyes y chanchos y en lo que se refiere a los granos secos, ella venD. maíz, papa y trigo y después los venD. en las diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito D. anta, la socia por medio D. estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a su familia, la socia quiere ampliar los negocios D. venta D. granos secos y venta D. animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor y alimentos para los animales.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes, agricultura, venta D. verduras, negocio D. venta D. frutas, ganadería y crianza D. animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “URPIS D. CONFATRERNIDAD” communal bank located in Cusco District which belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

Angélica is the member.  She’s married, 48 years old, and has two children.  She works in a business selling dry grains.  She also sells livestock like cattle, guinea pigs and pigs.  With respect to the dry grains she sells corn, potatoes and wheat at the various farmers markets that take place in Anta District.  She is able to support her family through these small businesses.  She wants to expand both the dry grains sales and animal sales.  She is asking for a loan to buy dry goods at wholesale and to buy feed for the animals.

The other group members’ businesses are: grocery store, farming, vegetable sales, fruit sales, cattle raising and animal raising.

The member thanks those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy dry goods at wholesale and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar D. 50 años D. edad es una madre D. familia que vive con su esposo y  sus 3 hijos, en casa D. su suegros, cuenta con solo servicio D. agua y luz   en el distrito D. TambogranD. a tan solo 1 hora D. distancia D. la provincia D. Piura, vive en la casa D. sus suegros , con los servicios básicos (agua y luz) ubicada en la zona rural D. dicha provincia. TambogranD. se caracteriza por ser una zona D. mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

María del Pilar se dedica  a la crianza D. ganado ovino (ovejas ) desD. hace varios años, su corral donD. se encuentran sus ovejas está en la parte posterior D. su casa.  A sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en el mercado D. TambogranD..  Con el dinero que va adquirir por sus ovejas podrá atender las necesidades diarias D. su hogar y familia.

A solicitado un préstamo María del Pilar a Edpyme Alternativa D. 500 nuevos soles paramejorar su corral D. sus ovejas, ya que han crecido y el corral que tienen les queda pequeño y también para comprar comida para poder alimentarlas  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorD. D. sus animales.  Con la buena crianza D. sus animales María del Pilar estaría asegurando la venta D. sus animales.

María del Pilar es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, dispuesta ayudar a los que lo necesitan y lo que más desea es mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
María del Pilar, 50, is a mother living with her husband and three children in her in-laws’ house, which only has electricity and running water, in TambogranD. District a mere hour from Piura Province.  She lives in her in-laws’ house that has basic services (water and electricity) located in the rural zone of said province.  TambogranD. is noted for being a zone with much farming and livestock raising activity.

María del Pilar has been raising sheep for many years.  The corral where her animals are is located in her back yard.  She raises the animals with nutritionally balanced feed like natural grasses.  Once they reach optimal size and weight they are put up for sale at the market in TambogranD..  She will use the money she gets from selling her sheep to meet her household and her family’s expenses.

She has requested a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternative to improve the sheep’s corral because they’ve grown and the corral she has is too small for them.  She will also use it to buy feed to insure the good growth and development of her animals.  By raising them well, María del Pilar insures their sale.

María del Pilar is known in the zone for being a hard working woman willing to help those who need it.  What she most desires is to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and to improve the sheep corral.

loans.name: Briceida Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Briseida, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen un lindo bebe de un mes de nacido. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella tiene un restaurante en sociedad con su mama en el cual venden todo tipo de platos pero sobre todo mariscos, ya que eso es lo mas buscan los turistas que llegan hasta esta hermosa playa que es muy visitada sobre todo los fines de semana, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 16h00, preparan desayunos, almuerzos y platos a la carta, nos cuenta que llevan con su restaurante ya por 8 años y que les ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  cinco años, es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para todos en el grupo. 

Su sueño es tener otro restaurante pero para ella sola.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre communal bank meets every two weeks in the San Clemente resort.   This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many local and foreign tourists.  It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional, regional dishes.

We met Briseida, 25, here.  She’s married and has a beautiful one-month-old baby.  Her husband is a Security Guard.

She has a restaurant in partnership with her mother where they sell all sorts of dishes but especially seafood since that’s what the tourists who frequent this beautiful beach that’s very popular especially on weekends, most want.  They work every day from 5am until 4pm preparing breakfast, lunch and a la carte dishes.  She tells us that they’ve had the restaurant for 8 years and they’ve done very well.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the dishes.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and she’s its Payment Supervisor.  She likes it because the loans are of great help to everyone in the group.  Her dream is to have another restaurant but just for herself only.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other meal preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Teresa, tiene 71 años de edad, está separada pero de esta relación tuvo un hijo el cual es  mayor de edad y en la actualidad se encuentra en Cuba estudiando medicina. Ella es modista, hace varios años aprendió esta profesión.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura hace muchos años, se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo, pero lo que más elabora es ropa deportiva, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, con ella trabajan cuatro operarias a quienes ella les paga un sueldo mensual, nos cuenta que en temporadas buenas tiene que pagarles hasta sobre tiempo por el trabajo que le llega.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  13 años, es la presidenta  del banco  y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es viajar y conocer otras ciudades.
texts.en:
The “1 de Diciembre” communal bank meets every two weeks in San Clemente.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists.  It offers diversity in locations and a delicious selection of regional dishes.

Here we meet 72 year old Teresa.  She is separated but is in a new relationship and has a son who is now in medical school in Cuba.  She is a fashion designer and learned this skill several years ago.

She’s had a small sewing workshop for many years and makes all types of clothing, but mostly sportswear.  She works by taking orders from individual customers, but also makes uniforms for institutions, local schools, and colleges.  She works daily from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and has four operators who work with her and t whom she pays a monthly salary.  She tells us that she also pays them overtime during good times.

She will use the money from this new loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies.  She’s been in the communal bank for 13 years and is the president of her bank and enjoys it because the loans are very important to her business.

Her dream is to travel and visit other cities.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Burbujass Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama las "Burbujas" y se ubica en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes es la cuarta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Celia D. es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de manera ambulantede que inicio hace 4 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ropa de temporada que le estan solicitan, ella tiene 29 años, estudio solo la primaria, vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada, cecilia quiere este prestamo para comprar mercancia de variedad para todos los gustos y con esto obtener más clientes y brindarle mejor calidad. Con las ganancias que obtenga desea una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia y poderles brindar educación a sus hijos y en un futuro poder verlos graduados en alguna carrera que elijan.
texts.en: This group is called “Burbujas” (Bubbles), is made up of nine members, and is located in the state of Puebla, Mexico.  This will be their fourth time requesting a loan.  Celia D. is the group’s president.  She buys and sells clothing on foot and has been doing this for four years.  She is asking for this loan to buy seasonal clothing that her customers have been requesting.  [Celia] is 29 years old and only has an elementary school education.  She’s in a live in relationship and has two children.  She’s excited about this loan and wants to use the money to buy merchandise for all likes and to win more customers with better quality merchandise.  With her increased income, she wants to provide a better quality of life for her family, and be able to provide an education for her children in hopes that they will develop the career they chose.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martina; ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de picantería, ella vende comida y también vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar la atención de su negocio de picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar la chicha y para comprar productos para cocinar la comida como arroz, carne y fideos.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, venta de helados, compra y venta de granos, negocio de venta de golosinas, compra y venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the “VILLA QUIQUIJANA” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Urcos district, which is part of the Quispicanchis province and the Cusco department.

Martina is 48 year old, single, and has seven children.  She works her food business, selling food and chicha (a fermented corn-based beverage), works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, and moves her children ahead through this business.  She would like to improve her customer service and is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients for making chicha and for preparing her food; things like rice, meat, and noodles.

The other members run grocery stores, sell ice cream, buy and sell grains, sell snacks, and buy and sell livestock.

[Martina] appreciates those who form part of this dream through this medium and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Zoila Miladys

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Zoila, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad que estudian en universidad y  colegio, todos aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. Nos cuenta que estuvo en los inicios pero luego se retiro y volvió hace cuatro ciclos y ahora espera no retirarse ya que los créditos son de gran ayuda en su negocio.

Tiene un pequeño restaurant en su casa cerca de una de las mejores playas de la ciudad, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, nos cuenta que la especialidad son los mariscos y que el pescado apanado con ensalada y patacones es el preferido de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días junto a su esposo desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor desde hace 17  años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos lo que la hace especial.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Sus sueños son tener una tienda y ampliar su restaurante.
texts.en:
The “1 de Diciembre” communal bank meets every two weeks in San Clemente. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers diversity in locations and a delicious selection of regional dishes.

Here we meet 53 year old Zoila.  She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 17 who attend university and high school.  They still live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  She tells us that she was one of the group’s original members, but then left and returned four cycles ago.  Now she expects to remain so that the loans will be of great help to her business.

She has a small restaurant in her home, near one of the city’s main beaches.  Here she prepares delicious dishes.  Her specialty is seafood; with breaded fish, salad, and fried plantains being a favorite for her customers.  She works daily from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm and says that she has had this restaurant for 17 years and that it has always done well.  Her customers prefer her food because the seasoning she uses make her dishes special.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare her food.  She dreams of opening having a store and of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores  es una mujer D. 55 años D. edad, cuenta con su casa propia y vive junto con su esposo,no tiene hijos, se encuentra ubicada en una zona rural del caserío D. Pomape que pertence al distrito D. Monsefú se encuentra a unos 20 minutos D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como principal actividad la agricultura , ganadería y artesanía.  

Dolores se dedica  a la venta D. verduras,  en el mercado del distrito D. Monsefú , con una experiencia D. 20 años , es por eso que es muy conocida y tiene su propia clientela.  Lo que le permite a Dolores seguir incrementando sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida. 

El préstamo que solicitó Dolores a Edpyme Alternativa fue D. 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mas productos alimenticios no solo verduras sino también frutas  y así mas adelante tener mayores ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su esposo que se desempeña como agricultor.

Dolores  es una mujer con muchos aspiraciones y uno D. ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más granD. su  puesto en el mercado y construir cu casa D. material noble (casa D. ladrillo).
texts.en:
Dolores is a 55 year old lady who lives with her husband in her own home, located in the rural area of the Pomape settlement, part of the Monsefú district, 20 minutes from the Chiclayo Province.  They don’t have any children.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock, and arts.

Dolores sells vegetables in the Monsefú district market, and has been doing so for 20 years.  She is well known and has regular, steady customers.  This allows her to continue growing her income to improve her quality of life.

Dolores will use the money from this loan for 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more food products, not only vegetables, but also fruits.  This way she will have more income in the future and will be able to pay the household expenses and help her husband develop as a farmer.

Dolores is a woman with many aspirations.  Among them is that, through her work and effort, she will be able to have a large stall in the market and also be able to have a brick home built.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: G.s. Jerusalen Ii Del El Viejo Group

texts.es: Jerusalén II Del El Viejo lo conforman Jasmira Del Carmen, Luz Amanda y Sady Del Socorro. Luz Amanda se dedica a una pulpería, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar sus diferentes productos. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes, ella y sus amigas decidieron realizar este financiamiento para poder mejorar los ingresos de sus negocios. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, grano básicos entre otros productos.
texts.en: The group, “Jerusalén II Del El Viejo” is made up of Jasmira Del Carmen, Luz Amanda, and Sady Del Socorro.  Luz Amanda has a general store where her customers go to buy different products.  She’s a very enterprising woman who enjoys interacting with her customers. She and her friends decided to request this loan in order to be able to increase their earnings.  This loan will be used to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and basic grains among other things.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Cruz es fundadora del Banco comunal, esta desde hace 15 años que se formó este banco y le gusta por el apoyo que le ha brindado la institución a través de los créditos. Tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aun viven con ella. Su esposo no trabaja ya que es operado del corazón.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta  y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que sus clientes le realizan muchos  pedidos ya que lo que vende es de muy buena calidad. Trabaja los días viernes y sabados todo el dia, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener un gran local comercial.
texts.en:
The “1 de Diciembre” communal bank meets every two weeks in San Clemente. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers diversity in locations and a delicious selection of regional dishes.

Mrs. Cruz is the communal bank’s founder which has been in place for 15 years.  She enjoys the support she gets from the institution and the loans.  She’s 58 years old, married, and has four children.  They are all adults but still live at home.  Her husband has not worked since his heart surgery.

She sells all types of clothing door to door and also out of her home where she has an area set up.  She tells us that her customers place lots of orders with her because she sells good quality merchandise.

Mrs. Cruz works every Friday and Saturday, extends credit to her customers and collects every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise every two weeks in Guayaquil and began her business with the first loan she received.

She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  She wants to have a large store someday.

loans.use: to buy inventory items

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es:
José es un joven de 19 años de edad, él es soltero, no tiene carga familiar directa, vive con sus padres. José vive en caserío “El Arenal”, en una comunidad pequeña de  aproximadamente 100 familias, cuenta con los servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica); esta ubicada  en el distrito de Túcume, ciudad turística que presenta  restos y pirámides arqueologías   en el norte de Perú.

José se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir (pantalones) y brinda este servicio en diferentes comunidades desde hace mas de tres años ,además José cuenta con ingresos económicos adicionales ya que realiza el trabajo de transporte de pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehiculo de transporte público que consiste en una  moto y una cabina para el transporte de personas).

José está solicitando un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa  de  S/. 2000 para que el pueda implementar su taller de costura con una máquina remalladora industrial, maquinaria que se utiliza para dar acabos finales en las telas, esta herramienta le será muy útil para la elaboración de las diferentes prendas de vestir que el necesite confeccionar.

José, es un cliente antiguo con buen historial crediticio, pues de muy joven sen su comunidad lo reconocen como un joven trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
José is a 19 year old young man.  He’s single and doesn’t have a family to support.  He lives with his parents in the “El Arenal” settlement.  It’s a small community, located in Túcume, a tourist city in northern Peru, with a population of only about 100 families.  It has basic services, such as water and running water and features pyramids and archeological ruins.

José is asking for this loan of 2,000 PEN, though Edpyme Alternativa, so that he can start his sewing shop.  He wants to buy a commercial detailing sewing machine, which he will use to put the finishing touches on fabrics.  This will be very helpful in making the various articles of clothing that he needs to complete.

José is a longtime client with a very good credit history.  He’s been known in his community as being very responsible since he was very young.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Dolores Miladis

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 24, 18 y 14 años, los mayores estudian en la universidad en Manta, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es obrero.
 
Es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse el sustento diario y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hace seis años decidió instalar un bar en su casa, en este bar vende bocadillos y comida rápida, además de sodas, aguas, jugos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que gracias a su negocio sus hijos están estudiando en universidad.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sodas, aguas, bocadillos, jugos, entre otras cosas para vender en su local. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  6 años, le gusta porque con los créditos pudo poner su negocio que le ha servido de mucho y por la unión que hay en el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The “1 de Diciembre” communal bank meets every two weeks in San Clemente. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers diversity in locations and a delicious selection of regional dishes.

Here we meet 53 year old Dolores.  She’s in a live in relationship and has three children, ages 24, 18, and 14.  The oldest study at university in Manta; the youngest attends high school.  Her husband works as a laborer.  She’s a great housekeeper.

In order to support herself and help her husband pay the household expenses, she opened a pub in her home six years ago.  There she sells snacks, fast food, soda, water, and juices, among other things.  She works every day from 3:00 pm to 9:00 pm and tells us that things have gone well for her.  Thanks to her business, her children are studying at university.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her business.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for six years and likes the fact that the loans helped her start her business.  She also likes the unity that the members have.

Her dream is to open a big restaurant.

loans.use: to stock her pub

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Unidos por el triunfo es una alcancía comunal en la cual participan ocho socios muy trabajadores y responsables cada uno en sus negocios pequeños. Clara es una mujer que le ha gustado generar sus propios ingresos muy a pesar que cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo. Empezó vendiendo comida fuera D. su casa y sus hijos le apoyaban; después tuvo que cambiar D. giro porque dedicaba poco tiempo a sus niños; inició poco después a la elaboración D. carteras y productos D. belleza lo cual no le fue mal porque tuvo ingresos regulares y con ello adquirió electrodomésticos para su hogar; también apoyó en los gastos D. estudios a sus hijos. Logró conjunto con su esposo comprar materiales para construir en el terreno que su madre le había cedido; aún le falta terminar D. construir y ello es una D. sus metas además D. plantar una tiendita en su casa. Clara cuida a personas D. la tercera edad cuando requieren D. su servicio. El crédito será para comprar productos D. belleza y accesorios para el hogar tiene pedidos por campaña día D. la madre.
texts.en: “Unidos por el triunfo” (United for Victory) is a communal bank maD. up of eight hard working and responsible members, each having her own small business.  Clara has enjoyed generating her own income even though she can count on her husband’s backing.  She began selling food outsiD. her house with her children’s help.  She later had to change the model because it didn’t leave her much time to spend with her children.  Shortly afterward she began making wallets and beauty products, which went well because it brought her regular income and with that was able to buy household appliances for her home.  She was also able to help with her children’s education expenses.  Between her and her husband, they were able to buy building materials to build on the land that her mother left to her, but it still needs some work and this is one of her goals, besides setting up her store again.  Clara cares for elderly persons when they need her.  She will use the money from this loan to buy beauty products and household accessories.  She has ordered to fill for mothers’ day.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for her store

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Cristo Rey D. Nicolás D. Piérola participan nueve personas muy emprendedoras que se esfuerzan mucho por darles lo mejor a los suyos y alcanzar sus metas trazadas, RoxA. es una D. ellas, es madre D. un pequeño niño, ella trabaja desD. hace dos años en un hotel cerca a su casa con la finalidad D. apoyar a su esposo quien es taxista D. su propio carrito. 
RoxA. venD. además productos D. belleza y joyitas ofreciendo sus productos a sus amistades y conocidos; algunas veces sus clientes le pagan con destiempo lo que requiere del capital a fin D. cumplir en sus pagos como consultora. Con los ingresos D. estas ventas y/o trabajo ha logrado adquirir algunos electrodomésticos y la adquisición D. su propio terreno que aún falta por construir; también para la educación a su hijo. El crédito que requiere será para invertir en perfumes, joyitas y productos D. belleza ya que está cerca la celebración por el día D. la madre y tiene regulares pedidos además con una pequeña parte del dinero apoyará a su esposo para hacer algunos arreglos al auto usado que adquirieron con la finalidad D. venderlo y comprar uno nuevo. Empezar a construir su vivienda es una D. sus metas que espera alcanzar a fin D. tener mejor comodidad para los suyos.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey D. Nicolás D. Piérola (Christ the King of Nicolás D. Piérola) communal bank has nine very enterprising members who make a great effort to give their families all the best and to reach the goals they have set. RoxA. is one of these members. She is the mother of a small boy, and for two years she has worked at a hotel near her house in order to support her husband, who is a taxi driver with his own vehicle.

RoxA. also sells beauty products and jewelry to friends and acquaintances. Sometimes her customers make late payments, so she needs capital to make her own payments as a consultant. With the income from these sales and/or her work, she has managed to buy some household appliances and her own piece of land, where she has not yet built a house. She has also paid for her son's education.

The loan RoxA. needs will be for buying perfumes, jewelry and beauty products since it is near Mother's Day, and she has regular orders as well. She will use a small part of the money to help her husband make some repairs to the used car they bought in order to sell so they can buy a new one. Starting to build her house is one of the goals she hopes to reach so her family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes, jewelry and beauty products

borrowers.first_name: Zegarra Calle De Garcia Mery Cristina

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
ector es un jovén solterode 19 años de edad que vive en la cas de sus padres, la cual tiene sólo servicio de luz, ubicado en el centro poblado (lugar donde viven pocas familias) de Chacupe bajo que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria y se encuentra a unos minutos del distrito de Chiclayo.  En éste centro poblado se desarrolla la actividad de la agricultura.

Hector se dedica desde hace 2 años aproximadamente a la actividad agricola en los terrenos que su padre le a dado para cultiuvar camote y maiz.  Son alimentos consumidos diariamente por lospobladores y muy ricos en distintas formas de preparación.  Una vez que cosecha sus productos los lleva a ofrecerlos al mercado minorista y mayorista de los diferentes distritos y con el dinero que recaude ayuda a su familia a solventar sus necesidades.

A  solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar abono para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y también su producto, ya que mas adelante al realizar la venta de sus productos podrá cubrir su préstamo y todas las nececidades que tenga en su casa con la única intensión de mejorar.

A pesar de ser una persona muy jóven Hector es muy empeñoso, responsable, honesto y trata de ayudar  a su padre en el cultivo de camote y maíz, con el único fin de que más adelante tenga sus propias tierras y cultivos.
texts.en:
Hector is a young single man, 19 years old, who lives in his parents' house, which has only electric service. The house is located in the small town of Chacupe Bajo, which is in Victoria District and is a few minutes from Chiclayo District. Agriculture is the main activity in this small town.

For about two years Hector has farmed the fields his father gave him for growing sweet potatoes and corn. These foods are eaten daily by the townspeople, can be cooked in several ways, and are very tasty. When he harvests his products he takes them to sell at wholesale and retail markets in the various districts, and he uses the money he earns to help his family meet their needs.

Hector has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles to buy fertilizer so he can improve his fields and his products. He has done this because later, when he sells his products, he can repay the loan and cover the needs they have at home. Hector wants only to make things better.

Despite his youth Hector is very hard-working, responsible, honest, and he tries to help his father grow sweet potatoes and corn. His only goal is to later have his own fields and crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Leonor Jaqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

La señora Leonor lleva 4 ciclos  en el Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por la facilidad para realizar los pagos. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 13 y 9 años que  estudian en colegio y en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un banco.

Ella se dedica a la venta productos por catálogo de ropa y de Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de lunes a viernes unas cuatro horas por dia, su forma de venta es bajo pedidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender y que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren a pesar de la competencia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa, bisutería, perfumes y cosméticos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Damas Positivas (Positive Ladies) communal bank meets every two weeks.

Leonor has been in the communal bank for four cycles, and she likes it because of the additional benefits the institution offers and because it is easy to make the payments. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children, ages 13 and 9. The children attend high school and elementary school. Leonor's husband works in a bank.

She sells clothing and Avon products (ladies' beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories) by catalog. She works four hours each day from Monday to Friday and makes sales by taking orders. Leonor delivers the products on credit and charges weekly. She says that she loves to sell and that she has many customers who prefer her despite the competition.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise like clothing, costume jewelry, perfumes and cosmetics.
 
Her dream is to have a large store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing, costume jewelry, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad. Ella vive con sus dos menores hijos, ella es madre soltera, Maria vive en casa de sus padres quienes la apoyan, ellos residen  en una parte urbana del distrito de Ciudad Eten a pocos minutos al distrito de Chiclayo.

María se dedica la elaboración de sombreros  de junco, ella  es una experta haciéndolos, conoce a la perfección este rubro pues lo aprendió de su madre, María  hace sombreros hace más de 17 años, contando a la fecha  con clientela fija en la zona, quienes admiran su buen trabajo   

María esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 1,500,00 nuevos soles que utilizará como capital para su  trabajo de la elaboración de sombreros, con la finalidad de compra de material, con el que producirá en cantidades mayores a las que usualmente produce y así generarle mayor rentabilidad, y poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos y sus padres.

María es una clienta nueva para Edpyme Alternativa, sin embargo ya se encuentra bancarizada.  No cuenta con competencia en su localidad y se considera como líder en su zona. 
Maria es una mujer luchadora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos e inculcarles  su espíritu  de luchar por ser cada día mejores y  progresar en base a esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and has two minor children.  She is a single mother and lives with her parents, who support her, in an urban neighborhood in the district of Ciudad Eten, just a few minutes from the district of Chiclayo.

Maria makes reed straw hats for a living and is an expert in what she does.  She knows the craft to perfection because she learned it from her mother.  Maria has been making hats for 17 years and has many fixed customers in the area who are admirers of her work.

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use as working capital to make hats.  She will buy materials to make more hats than she usually produces so she can generate higher earnings and improve her children's and parents' quality of life.

Maria is new to Edpyme Alternativa but is already involved in communal banking.  She does not have competition in her business location and feels like she is the leader in her area.

Maria is a hard-working woman who wants to provide the best she can for her children while teaching them the importance of striving to become better each day through effort and dedication.

loans.use: To buy materials to make reed straw hats

loans.name: Sofia Irina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sofía, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de tres años. Su esposo es administrador de una farmacia. Lleva en el Banco Comunal tres años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos está  creciendo día a día su negocio.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y esposa también se dedica a  la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También vende productos plásticos de cocina. Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas diarias, aprovecha las tardes que su suegra le ayuda con el cuidado de su pequeña hija. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Sus productos los recibe en su casa. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos plásticos de cocina.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "Damas Positivas" meets every two weeks.

Here we meet Mrs. Sofia, age 23, who is married and has a three-year-old daughter.  Her husband is a pharmacy administrator.  She has been in the communal bank for three years and she enjoys it because of the loans received that have helped her grow her business on a daily basis.

Apart from being a great mother and wife, Sofia also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) and plastic kitchen products.  She works two to three hours a day every day, and takes advantage of the afternoons when her mother-in-law baby-sits for her little girl.  Her products are sold on a credit basis and payment is collected every two weeks.  The products are delivered to her home.  She has been involved in this activity for two years and it has gone well for her.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and plastic kitchen products.

Her dream is to have a large shop to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and plastic kitchen products

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio tiene 43 años de edad, el vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos.  Demetrio y su familia viven en Campos Reyes es un poblado anexo del distrito de Cayalti, distrito en el cual se desarrolla abundantemente la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Demetrio se dedica ala actividad agrícola y tiene 10 años de experiencia desempeñándose en esta labor.  Para realizar su trabajo Demetrio tiene 2.5 de áreas de sembrío que son propias 

Demetrio es un cliente conocido por Edpyme Alternativa, pues el ya cuenta   con una experiencia crediticia con nosotros, y esta solicitando un  nuevo préstamo de  S/. 3000.  Este préstamo lo utilizará  para  invertir en su cultivo y poder comprar  insumos como urea, maquinara y semilla para el buen desarrollo de su actividad agrícola y así  optimizar la cantidad y calidad de producción.
  
Demetrio desea seguir contando con nuestro apoyo solicitando préstamos para  invertir en su cultivo, así seguir creciendo poco apoco y lograr adquirir más terrenos. En su localidad cuenta con un muy buen prestigio en su localidad, lo que hace ver que es una persona responsable y respetuosa
texts.en:
Demetrio is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two minor children.  He and his family live in Campos Reyes in a village near the district of Cayalti, which is very developed in agriculture and livestock farming.

Demetrio has been earning a living as a farmer for ten years.  He owns 2.5 patches of land where he grows his crops.

He is a well-known customer of Edpyme Alternativa and has had much loan experience with us.  He is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN which he will use to invest in his crop business and to buy supplies such as urea, machinery and seeds for proper development of his agriculture business so he can increase the quantity and quality of his production.

Demetrio hopes to be able to count on us to support him with this loan to be invested in his crops so he can continue to grow and acquire more farmland.  He has a very good reputation in his town and is a very responsible and respected person.

loans.use: To buy supplies and invest in his crop business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 58 años es soltera no presenta carga familiar directas.  Vive en un caserío llamado “Los Positos” en Mórrope –Lambayeque; un distrito que se caracteriza por la elaboración de bebidas propias de la región (chicha, bebida preparada en base a maíz o maní).  

Santos es una mujer con mucha dedicación y paciencia, se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a comprar y criar animales  como ovejas, cabras, caballos, ganado vacuno, y  aves como por ejemplo pavos, pollos y patos para que posteriormente los venda.  De esta manera Santos ha encontrado en esta actividad un negocio en la que se vuelto una experta en la crianza y así solventa sus gastos obtiene ganancias.

Santos esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de S/. 1500 para poder seguir continuando con sus labores. Con este dinero desea ampliar su negocio y tener más animales para después venderlos, mejorar la infraestructura de sus ambientes en donde habitan sus animales para mayor seguridad y comodidad de estos, comprar alimento en grandes cantidades por su menor costo.
texts.en:
Santos, age 58, is single and has no direct family to support.  She lives in a rural area known as "Los Positos" in Morrope - Lambayeque.  This is a district that is known for the typical beverages made in the area (ie. chicha, made from corn and peanuts).

Santos is a woman with much dedication and patience.  A great part of her life has been dedicated to buying and raising animals such as sheep, goats, horses and cattle, and fowl such as turkey, chicken and ducks.  She has become an expert in this business which has been a good source of income to cover her expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa so she can continue with her work.  With this money she plans to expand business and acquire more animals that she can later sell.  She also wants to improve the infrastructure of the habitat where her animals live for increased safety and comfort, and to buy wholesale animal feed in order to lower costs.

loans.use: To expand business and have more animals to sell so she can improve their habitat infrastructure

loans.name: Dolores Isela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres  hijos de 20, 16 y 13 años que  estudian en universidad y  colegio. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Tiene un negocio de imprenta y copiadora en su casa, aprovecha que su casa está ubicada cerca de un colegio de la localidad, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6h30 hasta las 17 h00 y a veces cuando alguien necesita algo hasta más tarde, tiene este negocio hace ya tres años y dice que en este corto tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
 
Este crédito es para comprar hojas de papel, útiles escolares, carpetas,  entre otras cosas. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos recibidos de la institución ha podido comprar ciertas cosas para su imprenta, como por ejemplo un crédito le ayudo a comprar la copiadora. 

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y prestar también servicio de internet.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "Damas Positivas" meets every two weeks.

Here we meet Mrs. Dolores, age 41, who is married and has three children, ages 20, 16 and 13, who are in college and school.  Her husband is a professional driver.

She has a printing and photocopying business in her home, taking advantage of the fact that it is near the town school.  She works Monday through Friday from 6:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and even later, if someone needs something.  She has been in business for three years and says that in this short amount of time business has been growing little by little.

This loan will be used to buy reams of paper, school supplies and folders, among other things.  She has been a member of the communal bank for eight years and, thanks to the loans received from the institution, has been able to buy things for her printing business.  One of the loans was used to buy a photocopy machine.

Her dream is to expand business and begin offering Internet services.

loans.use: To buy reams of paper, folders and school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Yesenia Maricela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

La señora Yesenia fue socia fundadora del Banco comunal pero se retiro por unos ciclos y volvió hace tres ciclos,  le gusta el banco por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de seis y cuatro años de edad, el mayor estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de cosméticos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días a la semana  desde las 8h00  hasta 11h00, sus productos los  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez al mes. Tiene siete  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, cosméticos y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Damas Positivas" (Positive Ladies) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  For many years, this city has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Yesenia was a founding member of her community bank but she withdrew for a few loan cycles and then re-joined three cycles ago.  She likes the bank for the ease with which she can obtain loans.  She is 28 years old, married, and has two children aged six and four.  Her eldest child is in elementary school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Yesenia sells all kinds of clothes and also cosmetics.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home where she has a small sales location.  She works three days a week, from 8.00am to 11.00am.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month.  Yesenia has been in this business for seven years and it is doing very well.

Yesenia will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, cosmetics and children's clothes.  Her dream is to own a large sales location.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes

loans.name: Flora Vicenta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Flora, tiene 43  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y tres de 15, 13 y 11  de años los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido es profesor de escuela.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Lebel, Avon, y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana en sus ventas y los fines de semana instala un pequeño local en el cual vende ceviches  y encebollados. Nos cuenta que su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, que deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva cuatro años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for years as the city of royal tamarinds, the Damas Positivas [Positive Ladies] community bank meets every two weeks.  

In this place we find Flora. She is 43 years old and in a common law marriage. She has 5 children, two of whom are grown and the others are 15, 13 and 11. They go to college and high school. Her husband is an elementary school teacher.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own resources, sells clothing via catalogue and Lebel, Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes and women's accesories). She does her sales three days a week and on weekends she sets up a small locale where she sells ceviches  and encebollados. She tells us that the way she does sales is door to door. She sells on credit and collects every week. She receives her products in her house and the clothes at a distributing center.
 
This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been in the community bank for four years and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are to have a boutique and for her children to be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Ledy Antonia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ledy, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 12 y 8 años de edad,  los dos mayores están en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, en la cual vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, artículos de bazar, ciertas medicinas y además útiles escolares y papelería en general. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local, nos cuenta que lleva 11 años con su negocio y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace mas de 6 años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio.

Su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
In Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, know for years as the city of royal tamarinds, the Damas Positivas [Positive Ladies] community bank meets every two weeks.  

Here we meet Ledy. She is 34 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 12 and 8. The two oldest are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.  

She has a food store in her house where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergent, variety store items, and certain medicines, as well as school supplies and general paper products. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later. She buys the products in a center in Portoviejo, although most are delivered to her locale. She tells us she has had this business for 11 years and it has gone very well for her.  

She is going to use this loan to supply her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, deli meats and variety store items. She has been in the community bank for more than 6 years and she likes it because through the loans she has been able to finance her business. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, canned goods and variety store items.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is 48 years old and married. She has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like shampoo, soap and canned goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

 In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business to support her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nellybeth

texts.en:
Nellybeth, a 27-year-old married mother of three children, works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income by being a dealer of Natasha, Boardwalk. Having previously borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy more store items to sell such as sardines, soap, noodles, etc.

Nellybeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Norsiana

texts.en:
Norsiana, a 27-year-old married mother of two children who are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a buy and sell crab/shrimp business in the Philippines. Norsiana is requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more crab and shrimp to sell.

Norsiana has been in this business for five years and would like to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more crab and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Pring N., a 60-year-old resident of  Siem Reap Province, has worked as the chief of planning in an organization since 2008, earning a formal monthly salary. Her husband, 67, is jobless. Pring has three children, one of whom works as a guide in a private company that provides tour services for both local people and foreigners.  Pring is requesting a Kiva loan to build a new hedge for her farmland.

loans.use: to build a new hedge for her farmland.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en: Marcial, a married father of two school-aged children, has been a farmer in the Philippines for 20 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and a variety of corn seeds to be planted on his farm lot. Currently earning PHP 100,000 each crop, Marcial hopes this loan will further grow his farm so he can more ably sustain his family and eventually improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds of corn.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 42-year-old married mother of four, operates a gravel and sand delivery service and sells hollow construction blocks, cement and iron bars, earning about PHP 30,000 per month. She has had this business for almost 20 years. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more iron bars and cement to sell and to pay her laborers' salaries each day. Her goal is to continue to work hard in order to provide her family with a steadily improving living standard.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy iron bars and cement to sell and to pay her laborers' salaries each day.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 43 years old and is married, with 2 school-aged children. He is a farmer and earns approximately PHP 100,000 per crop. 

George is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy at least 20 bags of fertilizer and 4 bags of seed variety for his 4.0 hectares farm. He grows corn and has been doing it for 23 years. George wishes to maintain his business in order to provide for his children's needs in school and for the family's daily needs. 

Someday, George is hoping to give his family a sustainable living through farming. He promised to be patient and to work very hard for the reality of his dream.  


About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: San

texts.en:
In Kompong Cham province, San H. and her husband are local farmers.  They earn a profit by planting a rice crop on their own farmland, which was  inherited many years ago from their grandparents. Besides the farming business, San H. also has a small business selling products such as fast foods, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, sweets, and other items for additional income. 

San H. is blessed with six children, three of whom are single and three of whom are married and live in other houses. Two of her children are employed in a variety of jobs. San H. is requesting a loan of $600 from Kiva through HKL to be used to purchase a used motorcycle for her children to ride to their workplaces.  It can reduce the cost of traveling expenses, and they can use it for going anywhere as well.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her children to ride to their workplace.

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en:
Elpidio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and corn seeds for his 3.0 hectares of fields. He dreams that someday his business will be profitable to uplift their living.  Elpidio is 63 years of age and married, with 5 adult children. He earns about PHP 20,000 per month as a farmer. He grows corn and has been doing it for 43 years. 

In the future, Elpidio hopes to make his farming business prosper for the welfare of his children, especially when they have their own families.


About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 40 years old and married, with 2 children.  Noralyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell in her general store.

Noralyn has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Noralyn aspires to save enough money so she can rent a space in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is 50 years old and married, with 6 children.  Precilla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Precilla has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.  Precilla aspires to save enough money to send her children to college and to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: Ken Y. is 46, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school.  They live in the province of Kompong Cham. She is in the rice-planting business.  She earns a daily income of $1.50, which she uses for utility, food, and miscellaneous expenses. In order to provide for the increasing daily expenses, her husband works as a building worker as well as helping in the farm field. Ken Y. wants to raise piglets in a cage behind her house, but she lacks the capital to purchase them. Ken is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Otgonbayar is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The two sons are both students in college. Mrs. Otgonbayar runs a metal stove manufacturing business together with her husband. They make wood- or coal-fired metal stoves suitable for gers and sell them at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Currently, they use their backyard as a workshop. The products are in high demand among people who live in gers. The stoves are used for heating and cooking purposes. Mrs. Otgonbayar wants to expand her business by producing more stoves to sell. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more metal sheets to produce stoves.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and materials to produce more metal stoves

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila works hard to support two children. She is a widow and has a general-store business in the Philippines. Lucila requested an 1,800 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick from her surroundings. Lucila is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cleaner, more efficient cookstove

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita works hard to support eleven children. She is a widow and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Lolita requested an 1,800-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family. Lolita is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cleaner, more efficient cookstove

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari business in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing 1,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation. Julieta is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cleaner, more efficient cookstove

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Mrs. Rany K. (pictured here) is 40 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vanny Em, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. They are in school. The family lives approximately 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Rany is tailor, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a butcher shop business.  Ana Maria requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.  She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because it needs less fuel to cook food than the firewood that she buys.  She wants the firewood to last longer.

Ana Maria is aware that, by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina works hard to support her family. Erlina is single and has a peanut butter-making business.

Erlina is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.  She is getting the Envirofit stove because it uses less fuel to cook food.  She wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer.

Erlina is aware that by using the Envirofit stove, she is saving money and she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Kom

texts.en:
Kom Y. is a 70-year-old widow living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. To earn a living, Kom Y. grows a rice crop on her farmland, which has belonged to her for many years. Her husband died several years ago because of illness. They were blessed with two children, one of whom is a construction worker, and the other one a garment worker.
