Kom Y. says her kids always go to work by renting a motor taxi. To decrease the motor taxi expense, Kom Y. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike. They will use this motorbike to ride to their job location.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her kids to ride to their job location.

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mrs. Mas L. sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman. They have eight children, five sons and three daughters. Two are married and live outside the famiL. home, one stays at home, and others assist their father in the fishing business. They live along National Road Number 5, about thirty-two kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

One of Mas’s sons wants to launch a new business selling clothes, using a motorbike to transport the clothes to places away from his house.  He does not have motorbike. So Mas is applying for her first loan of $1,200 to help purchase a motorbike for her son.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to carry clothes for sale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 54 years old and married, with 4 children.  Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-sari store and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell in her store.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from fish vending.  Edna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Badralmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Badralmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son studies at the Railroad College and her daughter is graduating from secondary school. Badralmaa works in a printing company as a machine operator. Her husband works in an electric grid servicing company as an electrician. 

In 2009 Badralmaa bought a plot of land and built a small family house. The house was built of wooden planks and it was completed as a basic structure. The house needs an improvement by installing insulation materials on all walls and roof and covering the insulation with one layer of brick wall. 

Mongolian winter is one of the harshest in the world and on winter nights it reaches minus 40 to 45 degrees of Celsius. The loan Badralmaa is requesting will be used to buy insulation materials for the walls and roof and enough bricks to cover the walls from outside. Also it will be used to install a low pressure heating system which uses less coal to burn and releases much less smoke to the air.

loans.use: To buy insulation materials for her walls and roof and enough bricks to cover walls from outside, and to install low pressure heating system which uses less coal to burn and releases much less poisonous smoke to the air.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mr. Bora R. (pictured here) is 26 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreikun San is 26 years old. They have been married for three years and just have a young daughter. They live in a village on National Road Number 2 about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bora and his wife are rice and mushroom farmers. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for use on his farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Samreth

texts.en: Samreth M. is married and has five children, two weave silk at home, one is a security guard, one is a goldsmith, and one attends school. Samreth is a silk weaver; her husband is a policeman. She hopes to continue her silk weaving business because it is a traditional profession. She is requesting a loan of $1,000, which she will use to purchase silk materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her silk weaving business

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Mrs. Narin M. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chanthol Kao, live along National Road Number Six outside Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have no children yet.

Narin sells sugar palm, she buys sugar palm from Kampong Cham province for resale in her local market. In addition, she also raises ducks and chickens at home. He husband is an aide-de-camp. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to buy more sugar palm for resale. She will use a part of the loan to purchase more chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy sugar palm and chickens for resale

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol C. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Sarun Chheng, have three sons and two daughters. Two are garment factory workers, two attend school and another one is still young. They are living in a village along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthol has been selling onsorm cake for fish for three years (onsorm is a kind of Cambodian cake that has rice, coconut with soybean and pork in the middle). She buys ingredients in the market in Phnom Penh to make onsorm at her house and carry it to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. In addition, she is also a lotus farmer. Her husband is a house builder.

Chanthol previously asked for a Kiva loan to fill in and concrete her house's foundation, but her kitchen was old and broken in some parts, so she decided to change the use of the loan to building a new kitchen.
 
She now is asking for another loan of $1,000 to continue her house's foundation improvement.

loans.use: to fill in and concrete her house's foundation.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S. and her husband, Mr. Noeun Chhuon, have been married since 1990 and have five children--one son and four daughters. One is a garment factory and the others attend school. They are living in a village along National Road No. 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chantha sells fruit, while her husband is a motor remoque taxi driver (a remoque is a motorbike connected to a trailer at the back). She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to improve her house's foundation.

loans.use: To improve her house's foundation.

loans.name: Samphoirs

texts.en:
Mrs. Samphoirs O. (pictured with her loom) is a widow with one daughter. She lives with her aunt on an island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her daughter is in grade eleven. 

Samphoirs is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay Y. and her husband Mr. Sophal Nou have three sons and four daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lay is a silk weaver and also assists her husband in his farming business when she is free. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. She is asking for a loan of $700 to repair and relocate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair and relocate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy B. is single and lives with her widowed mother on an Island on Mekong River 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She is a weaver. In addition, she also buys additional cotton and finished silk fabrics from other weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. She is requesting a loan of $1,000, which she will use to purchase more cotton and silk fabrics to sell..

loans.use: To purchase cotton and silk fabrics to sell

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun M. (pictured with her mother) is a widow. She has one son and two daughters. Two are in school and another one is still young. She produces soya milk and sells it in her village.

Seun lives with her mother on an Island in the Mekong River, about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She now wants to live in separate home, so she is asking for her first loan of $500 to add to her own money to put up the building.

loans.use: To add to her own money to build her own house to live in.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phirum C. (pictured here) is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Sarat Pech is 32 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh approximately twenty-five kilometers outside of the city. They have been married since 1999 and have three children-two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 

Phirum is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
From Phnom Penh city, Sem V. is a 30-year-old mother caring for two children. Both of her children are still living in the family home and depend on her income. Her husband, 49, is a natural medicine maker, who is good at combining different kinds of tree roots for natural medicine. 

Sem V. is a recycled goods seller - she buys used goods such as used bottles, cans, plastic products, and other old things to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. Sem V. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more used goods to stock up for  future sales.

loans.use: to buy more used goods to stock up for future sale.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad A. is from the village of La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old. Felicidad is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Felicidad owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store selling dry goods, canned goods, kitchen products and shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the community. 

In 2010, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods, kitchen products, soap, toothpaste, and shampoo to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felicidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods, kitchen products and soap, toothpaste shampoo to sell.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been in the tailoring business for 16 years in Kikuyu market and with a monthly profit of KES.23,444. She is a single mother of two children.

This is her third loan which she intends to use for buying more clothing materials for making dresses for her customers.The anticipated profits will be used to open another outlet for selling clothes.

In future  she plans to invest and open another clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For 13 years, Margaret W. has been selling eggs in Kikuyu market and earns a profit of KES.12,000 per month. She is married to Sospeter Muriuki who is a mechanic and together they have two  school-going children.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI and she has applied for a sixth loan of KES.60,000 after paying back the previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more eggs for sale. Her customers are mostly small-scale traders within the market.

In future Margaret hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop for eggs, and eventually become a large-scale egg broker.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in the "Matatu" transport business for the last seven years with an income of KES.20,000 per month. He is 42 years old, married to Lydia Nyambura and a father of four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he is applying for his first loan of KES. 30,000 to repair his vehicle by buying spare parts which will be used to fix it.

He will use the anticipated income to improve the living standards of the family. In future he hopes to grow his business and have a fleet of 67-seater buses.

loans.use: To repair his "Matatu" (van used for transport between towns.)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. is a 24-year-old lady who is married to Boniface and they have been blessed with one child. She runs a tailoring business in Mariakani and she has been in this business for the last two years. 

This marks her second borrowing from KADET. She plans to purchase more cloth for her business and to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: purchase more cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase business float in his "Mpesa" (cellphone money transfer business).

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi A. is a 47-year-old mother of six children. Her husband Hamisi is a businessman. She has been in the transport sector for the last two years but she also runs rental houses as a landlady. 

This marks her fourth borrowing from KADET to finance her business. Bibi plans to utilize the money in purchasing cement and building blocks to facilitate the renovation of her rental houses. She plans to use the anticipated profits in repaying the loan.

Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy cement and building blocks for renovation of her rental properties.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 30-year-old Mrs. Duong R. 's daily duties in the garment industry. She has been engaged in her job since 2008 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field. The couple help each other to earn money to feed their three single kids. All of the kids are attending school. 

Mrs. Duong R. would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase a used motorcycle to ride to work. Then she won't have to pay for a motor taxi when she needs to go work as before.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to ride to work.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket S., 35 years old, owns a wooden kiosk in the community, Reussey Keo commune, where she sells food for people who need to have a snack for evening time. She typically makes around $3.50 of profit each day to meet her family needs. She was married, but divorced her husband when her two kids were very young. Although she is now a single woman, she is a fantastic mother who has tried to send all her kids to school. 

Ket S. will be using this Kiva loan to add to her savings to purchase a second motorbike to replace her old one which often needs to be repaired.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Shelly

texts.en:
Shelly is from the village of Tuyabang Proper, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Shelly runs a business venture in the Arts sector, specialized in crafts in the local community. 

Shelly has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. Shelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. 

Shelly is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which she will use for the financing and maintenance of her wood cutter business. This will be the second loan taken out by Shelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the financing and maintenance of her wood cutter business

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Married and a mother of four children, Diosdada strives to provide a living for her family primarily through her small "cantina" and the vending of dried local fish in a small town in the Philippines.  She has successfully borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF in the past and is looking to assume a new loan of PHP11,000 for the purchase of ingredients and supplies for her cantina.  Diosdada aims to grow her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married. She and her family live in Pavlograd. Yelena runs a small retail business selling bed linens and sheets, as well as artificial flowers. She owns a kiosk at a local central marketplace. Yelena has been in this business for 2 years. She likes being self-employed and works hard to make her business successful and sustainable. 

Yelena’s business is the only source of income for the family. Yelena is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted artificial flowers for the " commemoration" days in Ukraine. They are several weeks after the Easter weekend when people go to the graveyards to remember their loved ones who passed away.  They decorate their graves with flowers and wreaths. Yelena is re-stocking her merchandise to meet the demand among her customers this season.

loans.use: to purchase assorted artificial flowers

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the picture are Kong S. H., 39, and her husband, 39. They currently live in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. To make a living, the couple cultivates a rice crop and some vegetables on their farmland.  They earn an income of about US$3 a day to cover the family’s needs. They have three single children, one of whom is working as a construction worker .  He often takes at least eight hours per day to work in the construction field. 

Kong S. H. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow doesn't support her field work.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married, with two children. He is a market vendor from Melitopol. Vladimir sells TVs, DVDs, hairdryers, etc. He has been working in this sphere of trade for 15 years. Presently, Vladimir has about 45,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His income amounts to 7,500 Grivnyas every month.  

Vladimir is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted household electric appliances for further retail sale at a vending kiosk. He is planning to buy assorted hairdryers, irons, CD players, tea kettles, etc., and thus diversify the selection of items he offers for sale. Vladimir is planning to do some remodeling and make some improvements in his house using generated profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of household electric appliances

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is married. She is a small private entrepreneur from Pavlograd. Paulina sells houseware, utensils, and souvenirs in the central marketplace of her home town of Pavlograd. Her merchandise comes at affordable prices, which always draws customers to her vending location. Paulina launched this trade 3 years ago. Currently, she makes about 4,000 Grivnyas of net profit a month.   

Paulina is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase a variety of dishware for further retail sale. She is hoping to re-stock her merchandise to offer a better selection of houseware items to her customers. Paulina is planning to re-invest generated income in further development of her business and eventually open a second vending facility, thus expanding her trade.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dishware.

loans.name: Pizaras

texts.en:
C. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 55 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, C. runs a business venture in the retail sector selling dried fish in the local community. 

C. has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. C. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. 

C. is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, with which she will purchase more different kinds of dried fish. This loan will be the second loan taken out by C. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of dried fish to sell.

location.town: Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ki

texts.en:
Ki C. is a local farmer and also grows fruit on her farm in Prey Chor district. She is married to Mr. Leng Art, 37, who is a fisherman and earns an average profit of $1.50 a day, which helps to share responsibility for the expenses with Ki C.. This couple has given birth to five children:  all of them are single. Two of them are employed, as a worker and a rice farmer. The family owns a medium-size plot of farm land, where they plant jackfruit, banana, and mango trees.
 
Fishing season is approaching and the lakes are full of fish, but the existing boat is broken, and it has affected her husband's fishing activity. Therefore, Ki C. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase a new boat in order to support his business activities. She hopes to use the rest of the loan to repair her old house. Ki C. is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat in order to support her husband's fishing.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman G. is a widower with children who are all grown up and married. His wife passed on last year, but he appreciates the fact that he has over 20 grandchildren who normally pay him visits during the school holidays.

G. is a poultry farmer who buys small chicks and later resells them after raising them well. He has been in this business for more than 6 years and gets a monthly income of Kshs 30,000.

G. is a new client in KADET and he has applied for his first loan, which he will use to buy 100 more chicks and feed. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to help his sons and daughters to pay school fees for his grandchildren.

He hopes to have a very stable business and to see his grandchildren grow and be well educated.

loans.use: to add 100 more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 43 years old and is married with two children, 4 and 6 years old. She earns a living by selling different goods, such as lotions, bananas, soap, rice, etc. This is her fourth successful year in this business. Her business is well organized. She operates her business from 6am until 7pm every day.

Beatrice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more goods, such as lotions, bananas, soap, rice, beans, salt, sugar, etc., to sell. By expanding her business and adding more goods and workers, Beatrice hopes to earn more profits, which she will use to reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell, such as lotions, bananas, soap, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ismaela

texts.en:
Ismaela, 29, is married with three children. She provides for her family through a small fishing business that she has been running for three years. She is looking to grow and improve her business by taking out a PHP13,000 loan through NWTF for the purchase of fishing gear and other essential supplies.  

The education of her three children, and the goal of sending each one to college, is Ismaela’s ultimate goal.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Edward Maina

texts.en:
Edward is 49 years old and married to Elizabeth Wambui. He has two children aged 23 and 17 years old. He has been running his farm for a period of 10 years with an income of about 10,000 Kenya shillings a month. 

This is his second loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy an extra heifer to increase his dairy production. He hopes to own a big dairy farm and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem K. sells various items from her own store in front of her home. She is 29 and married and has been blessed with two children; both are single. Her husband is a truck driver for a small company.

 Mrs. Chem K. is a busy woman who works hard every day at her business in order to earn money to help support her family. She will use part of this Kiva loan as capital to purchase more necessary items to sell. With the remainder of the loan she plans to buy some pig feed and piglets to raise. Mrs.Chem K. and her husband are in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell and buy some pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Cheow

texts.en:
Cheow S. is a 49-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with one child who is attending school. Her husband, Choew Soean, is 75 and works in the farming business. 

Cheow S. inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops. In order to enlarge the amount of rice they can harvest, she would like to ask for a loan in order to buy a plot of farmland which she will be using in her farming business. This loan will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for farming business.

loans.name: Kuluva

texts.en:
Kaluva is 40 years old and married to Agnes who contributes to the family income. He lives in Matuu and his business is in Malikiti. He has been farming for a period of about 20 years with an income of about 8000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his fourth loan with Kadet and he wants to use it to buy fertilizers and seedlings. He hopes to grow a variety of crops and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly V. is 31 years old and a resident Prey Chor of Kompong Cham province, where she earns a living raising ducks in a pen behind her house. She raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. She is married with one child who is enrolled in the local school. Her husband’s name is Sokny and he works with her in the business. 

Ly V. has applied for a $1100 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional duck-feed for duck growing. She will use the remainder of the funds to buy a used motorbike for transportation needs in her family. Ly V. is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase duck-feed and buy a used motorbike for transportation needs.

loans.name: Vivian Njeri

texts.en: Vivian Njeri is 35 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a poultry farm that has been in operation for three years with an income of approximately 10,000 KES.  Vivian is requesting her second loan with KADET of 50,000 KES after successfully repaying her previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy chicks and  poultry feeds. She hopes to own a big poultry farm, create employment for others, and give her child a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Top

texts.en:
Tending her rice-planting business is part of 53-year-old Top N.’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. Top N. has learned this business from her grandmother and she has been very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Ma Thoeun, assists her with the farm work and he appears in the photograph with Top N..
In addition to the rice business, the family also sells some cows to generate extra profit. The couple has three children, two of whom are married. All of the children are still unemployed and they help on the farm. Top N. will use her loan as capital to purchase additional cows to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows to sell.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn C. is a 27-year-old fish vendor and the mother of two school-aged children. Every day in the early morning, Orn C. and her husband go to buy fish from the fishermen. They then hurry to bring their fish by motorbike to the market for resale. In addition, Orn C.’s husband uses his existing motorbike to pick up passengers for a fee.
Orn C. wants to guide her business more smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to generate extra income by using her Kiva loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a used motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fish and a used motorbike.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora A. lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 37, single, and has three children. Gulnora graduated from the Pedagogical University and worked as a primary school teacher in the local area. Unfortunately, her salary did not cover her household expenses. That’s why Gulnora decided to work as a hired seller of detergents in the market at Osh. She worked hard and in 2003, using her start-up capital of 30,000 KGS, Gulnora started her own trade business. Year in and year out, she managed to broaden her business by purchasing a small shop and achieving success. Her loyal partners and customers were attracted by her optimistic attitude, responsibility and cheerfulness.
However, in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Gulnora lost her business. Her shop was robbed and looted. But Gulnora isn't giving up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this very reason, she is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. She plans to purchase a variety of detergents to resell at the local market. Gulnora’s motto is not to look back but to move ahead.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of detergents for resale.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: A villager who lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Seng P. is a 39-year-old married woman who plants different kinds of crops on her farmland to earn a profit. Her husband is a skilled builder of wooden houses. The couple has two children, one of whom is a garment factory worker. Seng P. has had great success growing rice crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may influence Seng P.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop. Seng P. is taking out a loan to a dig a well so that she can water her crops and she will also buy some fertilizers to keep her crop growing well.

loans.use: to a dig a well and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber for resale in his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.ru: Yadigar M. 33 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Yadigar projivayet so svoyey jenoy i detmi v Absheron regione uje 5 let. Yagidar seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari v osobennosti moyushiye sredstva (porashki, milo, shampuni, steklo-ochistitieli i t. da). On uje 4 qoda kak otkril etot magazin prodaji produktov. On ochen strayetsya i userdno rabotayet chtob razvit svoy bizness den za denm.
texts.en: Yadigar M. is 33 years old.  He is married and has two children.  For five years, Yadigar has lived in the Absheron region with his wife and children.  Yagidar now needs 2000 AZN to buy goods, especially cleaning products (laundry detergent, soap, shampoo, window cleaner, etc.) He opened his grocery shop four years ago.  Every day he tries very hard and works diligently to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale

loans.name: Jane Mbithe

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old and married to M., who contributes to the family income. They have five children. She has been running her farm for a period of five years, providing an income of 6,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her fifth loan cycle in KADET after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more maize and bean seedlings and pesticides. She hopes to improve the living standard of her family and be a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of soda, sweets and buns.

loans.name: Lucy Wamuhu

texts.en:
Lucy Wamuhu is 29 years old and married to Joseph Njuguna, who contributes to the family income. She runs a grocery shop, which provides an income of 9,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a staff member. She wants to use her loan to buy stock of green vegetables and cereals for sale. She hopes to own a retail shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of green vegetables and cereals for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old and a member of Mapema group in Faulu Kenya. He does stone quarrying to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has five employees. He was previously employed and he decided to leave his job and go into business so that he would earn enough income to support his wife and two children. He is looking forward to owning a lorry for transporting stones. He has requested for 80,000 Kes to buy sand and ballast.

loans.use: to buy sand and ballast.

loans.name: Tichakunda Group

texts.en:
Annie M. is the leader of the Tichakunda group. She is a 35 year old single mother of 4 children aged 19, 14, 10 and 5. Three of the children attend school. She has a business of selling Kapenta dried fish (matemba) and beans in Gweru-Zimbabwe. She has been running this business for two and a half years. She does not have any other sources of income. Her business has small profit margins that force her to push on volumes. 
	
Annie requested this loan through MicroKing for the purposes of purchasing dried fish and beans. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her household lifestyle and increase her disposable income. She envisions herself operating a shop with 4 employees. 

Note: Annie is the one in the middle - front row on the group picture

loans.use: to purchase Kapenta dried fish (matemba) and beans for sale.

loans.name: Oira

texts.en: Here we see Oira C. E.. He is 32 years old, single and makes a living by distributing bread to retail shops and hotels. He has been in the business for ten years and now has two employees. In addition to his bread business, he also works as a farmer. He has made good use of his membership in Faulu Kenya to grow both businesses, and he also hopes to open a bakery in the future. He is applying for a loan for 80,000 Kes to buy more loaves of bread to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Simukai Group

texts.en: Fungai M. leads a loan group called Simukai. She is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 13 and 3 years old. Her older child is in school, and she also cares for two other dependents. For the last seven years, she has made a living as a confectionery worker in her town of Gweru-Zimbabwe. She makes bread, buns, cream doughnuts, scones and pies. The major challenges she faces are competition, outdated equipment and lack of working capital. Her husband makes a living as a gold and chrome miner. Fungai plans to use her portion of this loan from MicroKing to buy supplies and ingredients such as mixes, yeast, wrapping, flour and fat. She is determined to increase her income by opening another bakery, and believes that this loan will help her achieve this goal. Fungai is the person who is sitting in the photo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies such as mixes, yeast, packaging, flour and fat

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 54 years old, married, has three children and makes a living by running a cafeteria. She started this business three years ago after spending several years working as a tailor. Though she runs her business in a highly competitive environment, she is good at retaining her customers. She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future, and will use this loan for 70, 000 Kes to buy more utensils and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy more utensils and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Насимов Хасан житель  Гиссарского района. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Старший сын предоставляет услугу, такси. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Hasan N. lives in the Gissar area. He is fifty years old, married, and has six children. His wife is a housewife. His oldest son drives a taxi. He makes a living by raising cattle. He raises cattle for resale.  He is taking out a loan to buy cows and smaller livestock (sheep or goats).

loans.use: to buy cows and smaller livestock

loans.name: Ebenezer Business Members Group

texts.en: Julius C. leads this loan group, which is called Ebenezer. He is 37 years old, married and has a 10-year-old child who is enrolled in a local school. In addition to his child, Julius also cares for three other dependents. For the last 10 years, he has made a living by running a general store and hardware shop in Neshuro-Zimbabwe. He will use his portion of this loan from the MicroKing Masvingo Branch to buy cement to sell to his customers. He believes this loan will increase his income and help him improve the welfare of his family. In the future, he plans to open a second store in the nearby town of Masvingo.

loans.use: to buy cement to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Perpetua Wanjiku

texts.en: Perpetua Wanjiku is 39 years old, married, has two children and has for the last two years made a living by running a pharmacy and cosmetics shop. She earns about 13,000 Kenyan shillings a month. She learned about KADET from one of our staff members and is now applying for her first loan. She wants to use the loan to buy more medicines and cosmetics to sell to her customers. She hopes to expand her shop and become a wholesaler because she believes this will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines and cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en: Artak M. is 37 years old, and lives in Geghamavan village with his extended family, which includes his parents, wife and three school-aged children. He used to work in a machine-building plant, but has since 1998 made a living by breeding livestock and farming. His wife and his parents help him -- and thanks to their joint efforts they raise cows, sheep and a pig while also growing potatoes on their farm. Artak is applying for his third loan from Nor Horizon, for 700,000 AMD, to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packets of mineral water, two bags of sugar, and six bags of bissap

loans.name: Beatrice Wanjira

texts.en:
Beatrice Wanjira is 42 years old.  She is married to Joseph Gathongo, who contributes to the family income. She has four children. 

Beatrice has been running her retail shop for a period of about 8 years and earns an income of 9,500 Kenya shillings a month.  She also has a farm where she grows maize, cabbages and beans. 

This is Beatrice's first loan with KADET.  She wants to use it to buy detergents, soap and tea leaves for her retail shop.  She hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards. She also hopes to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy soap and detergent for her store

loans.name: John Kimemia

texts.en:
John Kimemia is 53 years old.  He is married to Mercy Njeri, who contributes to the family income. He has six children aged 32, 30, 28, 24, 20 and 6 years old.  John has been running his farm for a period of about 10 years and earns an income of 6,000 Kenya shillings a month.

John was introduced to Kadet by one of its group members.  He is taking out his first loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. He hopes to expand his farming activity and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertiliser for his horticulture farm

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
In the photo is Agripina M. I. and her three-year-old son.  For three years, Agripina has been operating a salon.  She also relies on her husband, who is a driver, for financial support.  

Agripina says that before she joined Faulu Kenya, she had only one blow dryer machine and didn’t have a business premise.  Now, she is happy because she has an equipped salon.  In five years, she hopes to open a hair dressing school and a cosmetics shop.   She has requested for 50,000 Kes to buy Tong set, hair braids, pony tails and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken S. lives in Ddmashen village in the Sevan area with his wife, his mother and his brother. Babken is 32 years old and for 10 years he has been running his own farm. Besides animal husbandry, Babken is also busy with beekeeping and he likes his occupation very much. His family helps him a lot on his farm and with this shared work they provide for their family. 

Babken needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 20 beehives and bee colonies. This will allow him to increase his family’s income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy 20 beehives and bee colonies

loans.name: Jane Wakiirungi

texts.en:
Jane Wakirungi is 29 years old.  She is married to Danson, who contributes to the family's income. She has been running her spare parts shop for a period of 3 years now, and earns an income of about 17,750 Kenya shillings a month.

This is Jane's third loan with Kadet.  She has successfully repaid her previous loans.  She wants to use this loan to buy more vehicle and bicycle spare parts.  She hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy vehicle and bicycles spare parts to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beads, African design fabric and sisal fibre

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a single man of 33 years.  Joseph started in business by supplying cakes and snacks to retail shops to earn a living.  Later on, he started selling music CDs and DVDs.  It has been three years since he started his business.  

Being a member of Faulu Kenya, Joseph has learned how to save his money.  He hopes to open five other outlets for his business in the future.  Joseph has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy music CDs and DVDs.

loans.use: To buy music CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 32, is married and has four children.  It has been thirteen years since she started running Suzzane's Salon.  She earns her living from this business and from her cosmetics shop.  Before she joined Faulu Kenya, Susan had financial strains until she was trained on financial management.  She hopes to open other outlets for her business in other towns.  Susan has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy a DVD player and a television to provide entertainment in her salon.

loans.use: To buy a DVD player and a TV

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 35 years old, married and has two children.  He runs a barber shop (kinyozi).  In addition, he also earns income from his rental houses, pharmacy and water kiosk.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and has employed three people.  Now, he sees himself expanding his business further.  He has requested a loan for 30,000 Kes to buy a stretcher and tablets such as Panadol for his pharmacy business.

loans.use: To buy a stretcher and medicine for his pharmacy business

loans.name: John Njogu

texts.en:
John Njogu, 44 years old, is married to Ann Njeri. They are both farmers, and John has been operating his farm for a period of about ten years with an income of 8,000 KES a month.

John is receiving his first loan from Kadet in order to buy seedlings and animal feed. He hopes to own a bigger dairy so as to deliver more milk to the surrounding community.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha A. O. is 37 years old and a single mother of four. She runs a salon with two employees and has been in business for three years. She has been able to equip her salon with her loans from Faulu Kenya.

Tabitha has requested a loan for 30,000 KES to buy hair weaves and hair chemicals. In the future, she hopes to open another salon in a different area.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago padre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa de sus padres; es propia y cuenta con servicio de agua y luz en el caserio de Chacupe bajo ubicado en el distrito de la Victoria y a la vez pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Santiago  se dedica a la actividad agrícola desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, este trabajo lo realiza en los terrenos de su padre, siembra camote de diferentes especies y una vez que se dé la cosecha los podrá vender en los diferentes mercados de su distrito para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias.  Otra forma que recibe ingresos Santiago es mediante el alquiler de su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas).
El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar más semilla de camote, para poder sembrar en su media hectárea de terreno que su padre le ha dado y así pueda incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Santiago es un hombre muy respetado y conocido en el caserío de Chacupe por ser trabajador, responsable y buen padre, con el único fin de que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Santiago is the father of a family. He is 39 years old and he lives with his wife and their three children in his parents' house. He owns the house and he has running water and hydro sercies. It is located in the community of Chacupe Bajo found in the district of La Victoria of the province of Chiclayo. The population of this district are agriculturists and farmers.

Santiago has been an agriculturist for approximately 10 years. He carries out his work on his father's fields. He cultivates sweet potatoes of different varieties and once the harvest is ready he will be able to sell them at the different markets in the district. This will help him cover his daily needs. Santiago also has another source of income by renting his motorcycle rickshaw (a vehicle that he uses to provide transport in short distances, with a maximum of 3 passengers). 

The loan that he requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) is in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles and the funds will be used to purchase more sweet potato seeds. He will be able to cultivate the half hectare of land that his father has given him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

Santiago is a well respected man who is known in the community of Chacupe to be a hard worker, responsible and a good father. His only goal is to have his family not want for anything.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet potato seeds.

loans.name: Jose Manfredis

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 14, 13 y 12 años de edad, todos estudian y dependen económicamente de él, residen en la ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortas mexicanas, hamburguesas y tortillas, fue iniciativa propia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para elaborar los platillos: pan especial, lechugas, carnes, jamón, aderezos, y más ingredientes que son usados en su producción.
Este préstamo le ayudara a surtir el negocio y tener la disponibilidad para aumentar sus ventas; Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, poder estabilizarse y generar mayores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and their three children, aged 14, 13, and 12. They are all in school and they are financially dependent on him. They live in the city of San Miguel. He sells mexican hamburgers, hamburgers, and tortillas. He started under his own initiative.

He requests a loan to purchase products to prepare his foods: special bread, lettuce, meats, jam, salad dressing, and other ingredients that are used in preparation.

This loan will help him supply his business and to have the capacity to increase his sales. His aspiration is to expand his business, to stabilize it, and to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase special bread, lettuce, meats, jam, and dressings.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest M. G., 39 years old, has been farming for over ten years. He sells produce such as milk, eggs, kale and spinach.

Ernest joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access business loans easily. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy chicks. In the future he hopes to own a vehicle for transporting farm produce.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula es una mujer soltera de 61 años, sin hijos que tiene casa propia con servicio sólo de agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío de Paredones a unos 15 minutos del distrito de Morrope y a una hora aproximadamente de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura y la crianza de aves de corral.
Ursula se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral  (gallinas, pavos y codornices), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con maíz molido, polvillo de arroz y comida balanceada.  Posteriormente vende sus aves una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo para poder venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la provincia de Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.
El crédito que ha solicitado Ursula es de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra de  alimentos balanceados, con la finalidad de que sus aves engorden y pueda venderlo a buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo esos ingresos le ayuden a que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.
Ursula es una mujer que siempre ante los retos que le ha puesto la vida, siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Ursula is single and she is 61 years old. She doesn't have children but she owns her house which is equipped only with running water and hydro. It is located in the community of Paredones, about 15 minutes from the district of Morrope and approximately 1 hour from the province of Chiclayo. The primary business activity in this district is agriculture and raising foul.

Ursula raises corral foul (poultry, turkeys, and quail). The corral where she raises her livestock is located outside her house. She feeds them ground corn, rice flour, and balanced feed. When the livestock have reached an optimum level in development she sells them at the different markets in the province of Chiclayo, to increase her income and to support her family.

The loan that Ursula requests from Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner) is in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. The funds will be used to purchase balanced feed with the goal of fattening her livestock in order to sell them at a good price. This will permit her to repay the loan and at the same time this will help her family have a better future.

Ursula is a woman who has always achieved the goals she has set in life to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y leña, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 19 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda con ingresos parte de su salario, ella inicio el negocio por necesidad, aprendió a hacer tortillas cuando era joven y vivía con su madre, el horario que tiene es de 8:00am a 6:00pm, de lunes a domingo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, con este préstamo adquirirá lo necesario para seguir en la elaboración de las tortillas, además de poder aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es algún día tener la capacidad de reinvertir sus ganancias en el negocio  sin la necesidad de obtener préstamos, para tener más libre las ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the city of San Miguel. She sells tortillas and firewood. She lives with her husband and their two children, aged 19 and 8. Her eldest son works and he contributes with his salary. She started her business out of need. she learned to make tortillas when she was young and when she lived with her mother. She works from 8am to 6pm from Monday to Sunday.

She requests a loan to purchase corn and firewood. With this loan she will acquire what she needs to keep making her tortillas and to increase production. 

Her objective is to one day be able to reinvest her profits in the business without needing a loan, to have her earnings more at her disposal.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad que quedó viuda unos años después de casarse ,con su hijo, no tiene casa propia alquila un cuarto para vivir, el cual tiene todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe), ubicado en la zona urbana del departamento de Cajamarca.  La actividad principal de éste departamento es la minería, agricultura, turismo y ganadería.
María se dedica a la venta minorista de choclo y alfalfa con una experiencia de 8 años en el mercado principal de dicho departamento.  El choclo es un alimento rico y que se consume diariamente en las casas de los pobladores como en los distintos restaurantes de la zona porque lo utilizan para acompañar el ceviche (comida hecha a base de pescado crudo con jugo de limón, conocida en todo el mundo) y la alfalfa e una hierba que se utiliza para alimentar a diferentes animales de la zona (cuyes, conejos, etc.).  Con los ingresos que obtenga vendiendo mejoraría su nivel de vida.
El préstamo solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará en la compra de choclos de diferente especie y mejor calidad, su venta será más fácil por ser una persona que ya tiene su propia clientela.
María  es una mujer que con su esfuerzo y trabajo se ha sabido ganar a su clientela, por eso es muy conocida en el mercado de su departamento, con el objetivo de darle mejores oportunidades en la vida para su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of a family. She is 56 years old and she was widowed a few years after she married. She has one son and she doesn't have a house of her own. She rents a room where to live and it is equipped with all of the basic services (running water, hydro, indoor plumbing). It is located in the urban region of the department of Cajamarca. The principal business activities in this department are mining, agriculture, tourism, and farming. Maria is a retailer of corn and alfalfa and she has been operating in the main market of the department for 8 years. Corn is a delicious food and it is consumed daily in the homes of the population and in the various restaurants in the region. It is consumed with ceviche (a food prepared with raw fish and lemon juice known world-wide) and with alfalfa. It is an herb that is used to feed livestock in the region (guinea pigs, rabbits, etc.). With the income that she earns through her sales she will improve the quality of her life.

The loan that she requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) is in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles, funs that will be used to purchase different varieties of better quality corn. Her sales will be easier because she is a merchant who already has a clientele. 

Maria is a woman who has won herself a clientele with effort and hard work, which is why she is very well known in the market in the department. She wants to give her son opportunities and a better life.

loans.use: to purchase corn of several varieties and alfalfa for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Israel

texts.es:
Jorge es  un hombre de familia de 33 años. Es padre de un niño y vive en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado en departamento de Lambayeque, en un hogar humilde pero acogedor, que forjó junto a su esposa. 

Jorge labora construyendo casas, es maestro de obras y gracias a su desempeño en el  trabajo, se ha ganado una clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Jorge ha pedido un crédito de  500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, cuyo destino será la compra de andamios y nuevas herramientas necesarias, que Jorge emplea,  para la construcción de casas. 

Jorge pretende mejorar la calidad de su trabajo para satisfacer a su público ya establecido y ganarse nueva clientela, debido a que éste anhela ganar mayores ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 33-year old family man. He is the father of one boy and he lives in the district of Olmos, located in the department of Lambayeque, in a humble yet comfortable home which he nurtured with his wife. 

Jorge is a master builder and he builds houses. Thanks to his dedication to his work he has earned himself a stable clientele in the region. 

Jorge has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to be used in the purchase of scaffolding and new tools. Jorge uses these items to build houses. 

Jorge endeavors to improve the quality of his work to satisfy his existing clients and to win himself new clients. He strives to improve his income to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and new construction tools.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah W. K. is 28 years old, married and has two children. For two years she has been running a retail shop. She has managed to sustain her business through her hard work. She formerly sold secondhand clothes.

Hannah has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy rice, maize flour and paraffin. In five years she hopes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy rice, paraffin and maize flour.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, el cual está ubicado en el caserío de Saqa que pertenece al distrito de Zaña y que se encuentra a una hora de distancia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, agrícola y ganadera
Natalia se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos (baldes, tappers, juegos, etc.) desde hace unos años, ésta actividad lo realiza en un lugar que acondicionado en su casa, es una forma de ayudar a su esposo en la carga económica para que al final la familia prospere.
Ha solicitado un préstamo Natalia a Edpyme Alternativa por una suma de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos (escobas, recogedores, tinas, etc.) ya que el consumo ha aumentado en su caserío y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir el crédito prestado como para solventar sus necesidades diarias.
Natalia es conocida por los pobladores de Saqa por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy sacrificada con el único fin de que sus hijos se han hombres de bien en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Natalia is the mother of a family. She is 40 years old and she lives with her husband and children in a home that is their own and that is equipped with running water and hydro. It is located in the community of Saqa, belonging to the Zana district, at one hour's distance from Chiclayo. This district is known to be a tourist area and an agricultural and farming region.

Natalia has been selling plastic products (buckets, containers, toys, etc) for a few years. She carries out her business from a conditioned spaced in her house. This is her way of helping her husband with their finances so in the end the family is prosperous.

Natalia has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles in order to purchase more products (brooms, dust pans, tubs, etc.). Sales have increased in her community. With her income she will be able to repay the loan and she will be able to cover her daily necessities.

Natalia is known to be an enterprising, hardworking and devoted woman by the population of Saqa. Her only goal is to see her children grow up to be good men in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic products to add inventory to her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes, general articles of clothing, perfumes, skin lotions, and other products.

loans.name: Jose Carlos Emguelber

texts.es:
José, reside en  Alegría departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de plantas, vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, el negocio inicio por su propia cuenta y trata sobre la compra y venta de plantas, lo tiene ubicado en su propia casa, desde hace 12 años, no tiene un horario para atender a los clientes.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas caseras, Árboles frutales y semilla para cultivarlas, el préstamo le servirá para surtir el vivero, ofrecer a los clientes una mayor diversidad de plantas.
Sus sueños es ampliar el negocio, ser capaz de abastecer las necesidades de los clientes, y continuar con mucho empeño en el desarrollo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Jose lives in Alegria of the department of Usulutan. He sells plants. He lives with his wife and their children, aged 8 and 4. He started his business by his own account and it involves the buying and selling of plants. He has the business in his own house for 12 years and he doesn't have a fixed schedule when he attends his clients. 

He requests a loan to purchase household plants, fruit trees, and seeds for cultivation. The loan will help him to stock his greenhouse and to offer his clients a wider variety of plants.

His dreams are to expand his business and to be able to meet the needs of his clients. He is also committed to continue developing himself as a small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase household plants, fruit trees, and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es un joven de 23 años de edad que vive con su madre y abuela en el caserío Hornitos, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope (distrito perteneciente al departamento de Lambayeque).

Gilberto tiene un automóvil  con el cual realiza un servicio de transporte público cubriendo la ruta de Caracucho – Mórrope  (ruta de 30 minutos aproximadamente). 

Gilberto no puede darse el lujo de dejar de trabajar un día, pues el dinero que gana le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y  ayudar en los gastos de su casa, es por ello que trabaja todos los días en horario corrido.

El crédito que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2 000 nuevos soles, que necesita para invertir en el mantenimiento de su automóvil debido a que últimamente éste ha estado presentando algunas fallas que no le  han permitido, a Gilberto, realizar adecuadamente su trabajo algo que le ha generado una baja en sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a young man who is 23 years old and who lives with his mother and grandmother in the community of Hornitos. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Morrope (a district belonging to the department of Lambayeque). 

Gilberto has a car and he uses it to provide public transport services, covering a route from Caracucho to Morrope (the route is approximately 30 minutes long). 

Gilberto doesn't have the luxury of taking a day off work. The money that he earns is enough to cover his basic needs and to help with the household expenses. This is the reason why he works every day on a steady schedule.

The loan that he requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) is in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. He needs the funds to invest in maintenance repairs to his car. Lately it has been experiencing some mechanical problems that has prevented Gilberto from working efficiently and this has resulted in a decreased revenue.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle which he uses for work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Diana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Diana  D. 38 años D. edad es una madre D. familia que vive con su esposo y  su  hijo, tiene  casa propia, cuenta con solo servicio D. agua y luz  en el distrito D. TambogranD. a tan solo 1 hora D. distancia D. la provincia D. Piura y a unas 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Chcilayo. TambogranD. se caracteriza por ser una zona D. mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

Diana se dedica  a la crianza D. ganado ovino (tiene 40 ovejas en su corral ) desD. hace varios años, su corral donD. se encuentran sus ovejas está en la parte posterior D. su casa.  A sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en el mercado D. TambogranD..  Con el dinero que va adquirir por la venta D. sus ovejas, podrá atender las necesidades diarias D. su hogar y familia.  También cuenta con unas hectáreas D. tierras D. cultivo que su padre le heredó, en la cual siembra plantas D. limón para vender desD. hace 6 años .

A solicitado un préstamo Diana a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para  comprar comida balanceada para poder alimentarlas  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorD. D. sus animales.  Con la buena crianza D. sus animales Diana estaría asegurando la venta D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Diana is 38 years old and she is the mother of a family. She lives with her husband and their son. They own their home and they only have running water and hydro. It is located in the district of TambogranD., only about 1 hour's distance from the province of Piura and about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. TambogranD. is known for its agricultural and farming activities.

Diana has been raising sheep (she has 40 sheep in her corral) for several years. The corral where she keeps her sheep is located in the rear portion of her property. She raises her livestock by feeding them balanced feed such as natural grasses. When they have reached an optimum weight and size she offers them for sale in the market at TambogranD.. With the profits she earns from the sale of her sheep she will be able to proviD. for the daily needs of her household and of her family. She also has a few hectares of land that her father inherited to her. She has been cultivating lemon plants to sell for 6 years.

Diana has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for her livestock. This will ensure the growth and fattening of her livestock. Diana is assuring the sale of her livestock but raising them well.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her sheep.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma L. A. is married with two children who are in school. He is a businessman who operates a green grocery. His business is only one and a half years old. He was previously working as a casual laborer, mining to earn a living.

Through Faulu Kenya, Juma has learned how to run his business profitably because he has been trained regarding bookkeeping and financial management. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and oranges.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and oranges.

loans.name: Jhony Gilmer

texts.es:
Jhony tiene 34 años de edad, es padre de familia de dos niños los cuales tiene a su cargo y vive en el distrito de Olmos (en el departamento de Lambayeque), una comunidad rural.

Jhony tiene muy buenas referencias personales por ser un hombre trabajador y amable. Desde hace 10 años  trabaja dando servicio de transporte público, debido a que conoce muy bien la zona, cubriendo una ruta de Olmos al caserío Querpon y viceversa (ruta de aproximadamente 15 minutos).

Jhony solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de  llantas nuevas para su carro, esto le ayudará a mejorar su trabajo y obtener mejores ganancias.

Anteriormente Jhony cumplió de manera puntual sus créditos.
texts.en:
Jhony is 34 years old. He is the father of a family of two children, both of whom are in his care. He lives in the district of Olmos (in the department of Lambayeque) in a rural community. 

Jhony has good personal references because he is a hardworking and kind man. He has been working in public transportation for the past 10 years. He knows the region very well and he covers a route from Olmos to the community of Querpon and vice versa (the route is approximately 15 minutes in length). 

Jhony requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of new tires for his car. This will help him improve his work and to obtain better earnings. 

Jhony has previously completed his loan payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 45 years old and married with three children. For a living, she sells milk and eggs and also has a job. She previously sold second-hand clothes. Grace has sustained her business for two years and now she hopes to open another business selling other milk products.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy milk, milk jars, and crates of eggs.

loans.use: To buy milk, milk jars, and crates of eggs

loans.name: Carmiña

texts.es: Carmiña quien se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza por catalogo, desde hace mas de cuatro años, cuenta con una gran variedad de productos, la venta lo realiza tanto al contado como a crédito, vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres quienes se encuentran en el exterior,  tiene un niño a quien mantiene, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como maquillajes, cremas para manos, perfumes y esmaltes para uñas, etc.  ya que ella como promotora tiene descuentos y también compra cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción,  y  compra mercadería para almacenar y después los vende y así poder incrementar sus ingresos, es una persona luchadora que sola saca a su familia adelante, esta agradecida con la institución por al apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carmina has been selling beauty products by catalogue for more than four years. She has a wide variety of products. She completes her sales both in cash and on credit. she lives in her parents' house but they live outside the country. She has a son whom she supports. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise, such as makeup, hand lotions, perfumes, nail polish, etc. And as she enjoys discounts for being a promoter she also purchases cosmetics that are on sale. She purchases merchandise to keep in supply for later resale and to increase her earnings. she is a fighter who is solely responsible for supporting her family. She is thankful to the organization for the support given to her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as makeup, hand lotions, perfumes, and nail polish.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny es un hombre soltero de 22 años de edad, tiene casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de agua y luz, vive solo. Su casa está ubicada en el caserío los Mestas a unos 10 minutos de Sialupe que pertenece al distrito de Huamantanga y a unas horas del  departamento de  Lambayeque.  Esta zona es rural y la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura y ganadería.

Jhonny se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (medio de transporte público pequeño utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas,con un cupo de solo 3 personas como máximo), la cual alquila y cubre la ruta que va desde el caserío los Mestas a Sialupe y visceversa que sólo está a una distanciade 10 minutos.  Jhonny tiene su propia clientela por lo mismo que vive en el mismo lugar, ésto le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño que tiene y dejar de alquilar.

A solicitado un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para completar lo que le falta y poder comprar su propia mototaxi,lo cual le permitiría contar con más dinero para poder solvertar todos sus gastos y también poderles enviar a sus padres un poco de dinero para las necesides que tengan, ya que viven en otro distrito.

Jhonny es muy cocnocido en el caserío los Mestas por ser un joven de confianza, muy respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan sus transporte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a single man who is 22 years old and he owns his own home. It is equipped only with running water and hydro. He lives alone. His house is located in the community of Los Mestas, about 10 minutes from Sialupe, belonging to the district of Huamantanga. It is a few hours from the department of Lambayeque. This is a rural region and the business activities carried out by the population is agriculture and farming.

Jhonny drives a motorcycle rickshaw (a small public transportation vehicle used to transport passengers in short distances, holding a maximum of 3 people). He rents the rickshaw and he covers a route from the community of Los Mestas to Sialupe and vice versa. They are only 10 minutes apart. Jhonny has his own clientele and he lives in this same location. This helps him to have a greater income to accomplish his dream of no longer having to rent.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to complete the money that he needs to buy his own rickshaw. This will give him more money to be able to provide for all of his expenses and to be able to send his parents a little bit of money for whatever needs they may have. They live in a different district.

Jhonny is very well known in the community of Los Mestas for being a trustworthy young man. He is very respectful and responsible with his clients who use his services. His objective is to progressively improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle rickshaw.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro tiene una pulpería. Tiene más de 16 años de tener este negocio, ella tiene su negocio en su vivienda. Ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable por lo que se siente muy agradecida al tener un trabajo que le genere ingresos. Inicio con muy pocos productos pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad, Vicenta solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, leche, huevos, sopas, enlatados y detergentes.
texts.en: Vicenta del Socorro has a grocery store. She has had her business for more than 16 years. She has her business in her house. She has demonstrated to be a very responsible person and she feels very thankful to have a business that generates an income. She started out with very few products and her clients always request a wide variety of products. Vicenta requests a loan to purchase basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, milk, eggs, soups, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, breads, milk, eggs, soups, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 24 years old and married with one child. She practices both dairy and pig farming to earn a living. She was previously employed as a counselor before she went into business. She has sustained her business for one year and she is looking forward to having more cows and pigs in the future. She has requested a first loan of 20,000 Kes which she will use to buy chickens to raise on her farm.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo M. M., tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado, vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El con el crédito pretende pagar la mano de obra de la siembra sembrada y su posterior asistencia. El quiere llegar a tener una buena cosecha para este año y tener el cultivo en buenas condiciones para generar ganancias las proximas cosechas que vienen. El cuenta con el terreno y la topografía apta para la explotación del cultivo. También tiene muchos años de trabajar en estos cultivos por lo cual cuenta con mucha experiencia. El pretende generar las ganancias para tener un mejor calidad de vida y llegar a cumplir metas que tiene a futuro.al igual quiere seguir brindandole a sus hijos el estudio para que sean profesionales enel futuro.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo M. M. is 45 years old. He is married and he lives with his 4 children and his wife. They are his greatest priority. With his loan he plans on paying the labor expenses for the plantation and for later assistance. He wants to have a good harvest this year and to have a plantation that is in good condition to generate good profits for the next harvest. His has his own land and the topography is perfect for cultivation. He has been working in these fields for many years and he has earned much experience. He aims to increase his revenues to have a better way of life and to read his goals for the future. He also wants to keep his children in school to give them a career in the future.

This is his first loan with Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had previous loans with national banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan, greater benefits, and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to invest in his bean plantation.

loans.name: Carlos Gonzalo
